Reviews.Title: “Great location - good price.”
Reviews.Author: AlexisCarrington
Reviews.Content: Don't expect any luxury at all! This is a worn down hotel with a great location in New Yorks - in my opinion - best neighborhood. Placed in The Village and very close to Soho, you'll have great shopping and dining and real New York life at your feet. Breakfast is included which is quite rare in New York. It's not much - but you can start the day with some buttered toast and a cup of coffee. The rooms are clean and that is just about all there is to say about them. Don't expect to be charmed. Bathrooms and toilets are shared and fortunately clean. I've stayed at The Larchmont twice and will probably go again because of the price and the great location. It leaves more money for shopping and experiencing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDurham
Reviews.Content: Larchmont is inexpensive by NYC standards. It is a 2 star hotel. We stayed last spring for a week after Memorial Day, which was also our fourth visit (I think) since 2002. Room and bathrooms were always clean. Great neighborhood. Feels safe. Decent little continental breakfast included. We are returning again this Spring. I recommend spending the extra money for one of the rooms overlooking 11St. The inner rooms are really cramped and can be dark. We are going to try the double in the back of the building overlooking the courtyard on our next trip. We'll review that, too. Sorry so many people had bad experiences - seems like everyone I meet there is happy to have a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A room for the location, and nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Budotis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was billed as the hidden gem of the West Village on several websites and travel guides. I booked four nights in the winter and got one night free. The hotel--calling it such is a stretch-- is a tiny building among residential apartments on 11th Street. There is a small lobby, and not much else by way of amenities. I stayed in a closet of a room overlooking 11th Strret, for 3 nights, then was moved to a larger room that had no view whatsoever. The small room had a bed, a desk, and a closet. There is hardly room to walk. A sink is in the corner of the room. The cot is fairly uncomfortable, and the shared bathroom and shower are very small. Down the hall are full-time residents who sit with the door opened. One saw me and followed me down the hallway. It was odd. The larger room was similar in furniture, but the heat was unbearably warm, and the cot very uncomfortable and loud when you move. The doors are adjar so light seeps in from the brightly lit hallways. If you want to stay in the Village, and are on a tight budget, try the hotel Jane, further West, near the High Line. The Larchmont is nothing more than a run down building in a great tree-lined neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay-not a good value despite good location”
Reviews.Author: donpadia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three times and the overall condition of the place seems to have deteriorated to the point where it does not offer the minimal conditions for a comfortable stay. We stayed there this last month during a frigid cold weekend, our small room was very cold since the heater sputtered hot water and rattled but did not work. The bed was supposed to be full size for two adults but the blankets were too small and did not fit the bed. The toilet stopped working in the middle of the night and could not be fixed. Additionally, the shared bathrooms lack a sink or any kind of hand washing facilities, which means everybody has to return to their rooms to wash up in the small sink inside the room: I would guess every door knob in this hotel should be disinfected several times a day, but it isn't...

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hot and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Donofnh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just after Christmas (2011) and was quite disappointed. Shared bath I knew about; okay, the room doesn't cost much; i made concessions. Unfortunately the toilet stopped working in one of the 2 bathrooms and the staff, nice as they were, couldn't make it work reliably. When I used the other toilet it was so cramped I had to move my legs to the side to close the door. In my room the window was small and so dirty I could barely see the courtyard below; the bare steam pipe that provide the heat couldn't be turned down so the room was about 85 degrees most of the time. The carpet was really gross.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: 5nights, small Double room about US$145 per night after all taxes. (Cheap especially since we were staying leading up to New Years Eve). Other accomodation was absorbently priced!) Pros - Small hotel in a quiet neighbourhood. Great location within 5-7mins of Metro lines and great value in New York City. - Security very good - 3 Keys required to enter (front door, hallway, room key) - Staff very helpful and friendly - Complementary continental breakfast - small selection of tea, coffee, juice, pastries, toast and apples. Nothing special but sufficient. -Shared bathroom/toilet - 2 in hallway always seemed to be available when required and clean. -Complementary computer and printer in their reception area but wifi connection in our rooms was poor. Cons - Very small double room - We were on 5th floor west next to the hallway door, so a little noisy at times. -Building had 3 wifi connections but we could not get a good connection from any of them. The lobby had good connection if we went and sat on the 2nd floor steps. -No tea/coffee facilities. Overall great location and value in NYC. It tries to provide the extras such as wifi, breakfast, service which is a nice touch but could be better. Then again you dont really stay here for 5 star service. Does the job of a good night sleep and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the location”
Reviews.Author: toscorlando
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy establishment, or a place you'd want to come home to every night forever, but it can't be beaten for its Greenwich Village location. I did a lot of research into the best value for money in New York, since we're on a budget that doesn't go far in this town, and I think the Larchmont is a great compromise as somewhere comfortable, quiet and well-located while remaining a lot more affordable than somewhere with perhaps more up-to-date bedspreads. Our room was undeniably a touch shabby and utilitarian, but sunny and clean and of a decent size - there was plenty of room to move around the bed even with our large cases open. There was a well-sized chest-of-drawers and wardrobe with robe and slippers. It was very quiet from both inside and out the hotel; there was some noise from the central-heating pipes that sounded weirdly like an animal whimpering at first, until I realised what it was - all part of the New York charm and novelty. I'd specifically asked for a quiet room in the booking submission, and was grateful we'd been granted one at the far end of a corridor on the third floor, with a kitchen no one ever used on our other side. I'm never overly enthusiastic about the whole negotiating-of-shared-bathrooms thing, but this was offset by the convenient sink and mirror in the room, so traipsing up and down the hallway for every little handwashing or makeup-applying was minimised. In three days, I never once had to wait for the bathroom or toilet to be vacated, and they were kept spotlessly clean. They might have been old and utilitarian and covered in decades of reapplied cream paint, but they fulfilled their task. There was a breakfast included in the room rate, which was served across a counter in a small room in the basement by a woman not to be messed with - it was like being at boarding school. The breakfast was pretty basic - pastries, packaged juice, apples - and we used it to take the edge off and then strolled over to Greenwich Avenue to Soy Cafe for real coffee most mornings. We only met the staff briefly, but they were all friendly and helpful, especially the man who helped us upstairs with our luggage and then greeted us whenever we came and went. The cleaning women were pleasant whenever we briefly encountered them. Other reviews have complained about the smell in the stairwell, and I noticed that too, but couldn't really care about it - it's just a characterful old building with over a century's worth of accumulated boiled-cabbage cooking smells. Why are people so picky about unimportant details when they're paying $140 for a double room in Greenwich Village?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Cecylia2345
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheapest hotels we were able to find in New York which worried us a bit however it turned out to be a very good decision! First of all, its in a fantastic location (Greenwich) and within walking distance to the Meat Packing District, the Washington and Union Squares and great restaurants, nightlife and shops! The hotel was very clean, included contintinental breakfast and the shared bathrooms were not a problem once during our 5 day stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dee K
Reviews.Content: I have just spent two weeks in New York and stayed at this little gem of a Hotel, i would highly recommend this place. Is in a stunning very safe location, close to subways and a very interesting part of NY city, a very artistic area and also just near all the gay bars/scene I am a single woman and had the best time here in the village. The hotel is basic, but very clean and comfortable. Great value for money. Includes free wifi, computer and use of printer p Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: pgwLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights and found it very convenient between Union and Washington Squares. Staff are very friendly and helpful and breakfast is a bonus. We had a room on the ground floor which was very warm and it seemed strange in November to use the air-conditioning to bring it down to comfortable. Staff worked hard at keeping shared facilties clean. Lots of people staying at Larchmont had been coming for years and enthused about it. So give it a go if you want to avoid hyper-expensive Mnhattan hotels.

Reviews.Title: “actually better than before”
Reviews.Author: greatpond
Reviews.Content: Been staying here once a year for 5-6 years and it's the same value and safe haven for travelers. There has been some painting, some sprucing up and some mild updating. What remains is a convenient place within 4-5 blocks from a multitude of subways, great restaurants, Union Square with a great farmer's market Fri & Sat. For someone traveling alone especially this place is so safe. You need three different keys to get to your room. The people there this last time were universally pleasant and helpful. The morning coffee was good and it makes a difference to be able to go downstairs instead of having to go outside for that first cup. The price is right especially comparing other NYC properties. Yes the bathroom and shower are down the hall but the robe they have for you is warm and the slippers work. Never had to wait for the facilities. They will also let you store your bags if you aren't leaving NYC at the check out time and since there are so many subway stops around you can spend the day being a tourist and then come back later to pick up your bags. A great place!

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: joekoliver
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont's location in Greenwich Village appealed to us and it did not disappoint. Lots of interest within 20 minutes walk (eg Washington Square in the evening to listen to the impromtu music) and ease of access to the subway. We felt very safe and relaxed in the area. It was also a good base from which to head to all the major tourist sites. The room itself was slightly small and modest although it was clean and well serviced every day. Being at the back of the building it was very quiet although a bit dark but no big deal as we were out all day. We knew when we booked that we would be sharing toilet and bathroom and would have access to a kitchen. We had no problem with the sharing aspect but what disappointed was the very poor facilites. The shower was over a small narrow bath but instead of the shower being at one end of the bath it was mounted on the wall halfway along the bath. This meant there was hardly any room to turn without catching against the plastic shower curtain. It was absolutely awful so that showers were taken quickly. If the bathroom was bad the kitchen was a total disaster area. It had a large fridge, cooker etc but no pots or pans, no cutlery, no plates or dishes ... but it had a table! However the whole area was grubby and very uninviting. We could therefore only use the fridge. We felt cheated as a result. As others have said the reception is uninviting and the staff there not very friendly. The corridors and upstairs layout is also not appealing although the decor seemed fresh and clean. Then there was the breakfast room downstairs which was pretty awful and the staff unfriendly. The continental breakfast was very meagre with little choice. Having said all that, with a little effort like putting bombs under the bathroom and kitchen, smashing the glass wall in reception and sacking all the staff (apart from the cleaners) there could be a perfectly pleasant hotel in a nice part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel in the West Village”
Reviews.Author: SavvyFaire
Reviews.Content: A lovely old brownstone with bargain rooms in a terrific location, the Larchmont is a find for the budget-conscious traveler. I stayed in one of the "cozy" rooms - which means it was TINY. About 5' x 10'. However, it had everything I needed for a one-night stay. Bed was comfortable, the little flat-screen TV on the wall was well-placed, I had my own bathrobe and slippers, a sink, a hairdryer and toiletries, a cute little reading lamp by the bed and there were hooks and a luggage rack. There was an extra blanket and pillow. There were two toilets/showers just down the hall, which were perfectly clean. Also, there was a full kitchen on the hall, with a refrigerator and stove and pots and pans, so if you stayed for more than a couple of days, you could cook breakfast or store juice or whatever. The lobby was bright and comfortable with free WiFi and an iBook and printer for use by the guests. Downstairs was kind of a cafe where they served a continental breakfast with coffee, tea, juice and pastries (fresh!) The staff was very friendly and welcoming - the bellhop took me up to my room and showed me how to work the keys. (Place felt very secure - key for the front door, key for the door to your wing, key for your room.) ONLY DOWNSIDE: My room got VERY hot, because it was so small and no way to adjust the heat. It was unseasonably warm for November...however, I managed this by turning on the air conditioner. I am staying here again next month with my daughter in one of the larger rooms and I am very pleased to find a place in NYC with a private room that is this nice for this price. PS: I have to say, I don't know WHAT the reviewed below me ("NoneNamedYet") is on about. Yes, there is a glass window in the lobby for check-in...so what? No different than many guest houses. The rooms are clean and bright (yes, and small) and the furniture is fine - certainly not "like something that was taken in from the street!" If there's "much better that you can get for the same price" I'd like to know about it!

Reviews.Title: “The people who are praising this hotel have very different viewpoint and standards!”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: When reading the glowing reviews I wondered if this was the same place, or if the hotel had done a quick-fast full renovation since we were there. No, looking at the photos, it seems to be same place. Sure, they didn't show the skankier rooms, like where we stayed, or the big glass barrier from behind which business is done. Or allude to the "regulars" who have been known to come and go from here. The hotel is on one of the loveliest streets in the West Village. The outside is quaint and old-school and gives the feeling of a serene but well-apointed smaller hotel. We asked to see a few rooms before we signed in. One had a window that faced an ally, but nothing in the way of even meager security on that window. One looked out at the back, also on first floor, also with minimal security. Single bed, with nubby white bedspread, broken dresser that surely was taken in from off the street, a large plastic garbage can, and something like a faux oil painting in a frame. Tiny room. Looked like where a pauper would live. Price: much higher than it should be. And yet... the kids and the 'dollar-conscious' keep coming here. I think they're being fooled. there's much better that you can get for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to pass by...”
Reviews.Author: Time2SeeItAll
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont is perfect for the traveller who is using their money efficiently whilst seeking accommodation in an excellent location which is also safe & clean. We stayed for 14 nights and found the location very close to accessing the subway, food/nightlife and all varieties of stores in the general vicinity. The bedding was fine, fairly warm at night but we were able to keep the window open without outside noise keeping us awake. The staff are friendly and there's 24hr internet access if you don't have your own device.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Manhattan at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: jonharis
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I decided to make a trip to New York we wanted to experience it like someone who lived there. We were touring the PA, MD area in a rental car and drove into the island via the Holland Tunnel (This is something we recommend everyone do once because it offers a completely different feeling than taking a cab/train). We easily found the hotel but of course being in Greenwich Village none was to be found. I unloaded the car at the door and then found a garage about 3 blocks away. $90 + a good tip for a good spot got me 3 days there. Room Check in was smooth although the desk staff could have been nicer. We stayed in a rear third floor room. The room was small but comfy with a queen bed, sink, table and dresser. There was no room to stretch our legs but we were not on the island to stay in our hotel. AC and heat worked just fine. The hotel is "European" style meaning the bathrooms are shared. This was our first stay at a place like this so we were a little apprehensive. It turns out that the restrooms were always vacant (only a few rooms per floor), impeccably clean (it always looked like we were the first ones to use them when we did), and spacious. The hotel provides a robe and slippers which was a nice touch. Breakfast A light continental breakfast was served in the am in the hotel basement which included typical pastries, bagels, coffee, tea and juice. It was a nice touch. Service Other than check in we found the doorman/bellhop to be exceptional. He was knowledgeable about the area and was more than happy to steer us away from touristy attractions when we asked. Maps were provided and the hotel also had internet and printing ability (we had forgotten to print show tickets and they printed them for us). The lobby is small but comfortable, with a couple of chairs. Security In addition to the doorman, each floor was only accessible by the people staying on that floor. The hallways were always quiet. Location The location was one of the main draws for us. Step outside the front door and you instantly know you are in GV. The Washington park was only a few blocks away and the closest subway was literally around the corner. We found ourselves strolling around the area in the evenings and always felt safe. Overall it was a 5 star stay. the mediocre service on check-in was the only thing that I thought should be improved on.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, great value”
Reviews.Author: maria12d
Reviews.Content: Our room had complimentary toiletries, small flat screen tv and bathrobe and slippers. Our bathroom was in the hallway, but we had a sink and a hairdryer in the room. The staff was friendly. Place is very clean and conveniently located. Breakfast is euro style. Pastries and bread.

Reviews.Title: “I did stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMcKinnon
Reviews.Content: Last year I wrote a review that said that I'd stay here again. I did so about a week ago. I'm glad I returned. The price for NYC seemed to be a good value. The desk staff were friendly and helpful. I was able to print my boarding pass using the MacBook in the lobby. Sometimes crisp, cellophane-wrapped apples were available in the lobby. For me a couple of pieces of toast and marmalade,, a small pastry, and a glass of orange juice was sufficient for me. Breakfast is available from 7:30 to 10 am. Check-n is 3 pm; check-out is Noon. One can leave baggage on a rack in the lobby. A doorman handles the baggage check. I stayed in two different rooms. The bed in the more economical room was spartan; I slept well, though. The second room was slightly wider; the bed was a bit better. The T.V.s offered about a dozen channels, most of which offered acceptable pictures. The air conditioning worked well and quietly. The ceiling fan was quiet, and appreciated. A bathrobe and slippers were appreciated for the short trip to the clean bathrooms and showers. The hotel is located in Greenwich village just west of 5th Avenue. Subway stops are 5-10 minutes from the hotel and offer two choices for trips to / from JFK for the price of a subway ticket ($2.25) and an AirTram ($5.00) ticket available at the airport subway stop. $7.25 and about 75 minutes seems reasonable for a Manhattan / JFK Transfer. At the risk of repetition, I'd stay here once again

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, great location. Excellent for the price.”
Reviews.Author: ekou3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights out of a month's stay whilst our apartment was being made available to us. We stayed on the 2nd floor (which i think is referred to as the 3rd floor by Americans) in a regular double room. The check-in staff were very friendly and efficient. The porter helped us with our bags up the stairs and we tipped accordingly. The room was very clean, not as small as I had thought it might be. We were tossing up getting the Queen sized room which has extra room around the bed and a table - but for such a short stay this was not a real requirement and we were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. The room had a desk, wash basin, bedside table, lamp, TV and wireless. We were located right next to the hallway toilet and shower. We were facing the internal light-well/courtyard. At no time did we have to wait for the bathroom/WC nor did we experience any noise from any of the other guests staying on our floor using the amenities or external noise. Very quiet all round. I did find the bathroom on our floor a *very* tight squeeze but we had friends stay in a Queen room on the floor above and their bathroom was not like this - so it seems the bathrooms vary from floor to floor. There was a second bathroom further down the hall which I did not investigate - had we stayed longer I would have taken a look. The light breakfast is exactly that - some pastries, toast, tea, coffee and juices. I enjoyed getting a glass of juice and a pastry before I headed out for a full breakfast in the morning. The lady serving the food is a tough nut to crack - a smile wouldn't go astray - but hey! Overall the location is brilliant, the rooms very clean and for the price there really is not any comparison - unless you want to try some dodgy bed bug ridden places in midtown west or chinatown (believe me we looked before we booked this place).

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Helen F
Reviews.Content: The value of this fantastic hotel is incredible. It's so clean and friendly with wi-fi in the rooms and a just a great atmosphere. The location couldn't be better and the street very pretty. I am used to staying in 5 star hotels for business and I get bored of how standard they are. I liked the rooms in the Larchmont and I didn't mind one bit having to share a bathroom - they were very clean and you get slippers and a bath robe so don't let it put you off. The room we had was a double and it was a decent size.

Reviews.Title: “A great and simple place to stay in Greenwich Village”
Reviews.Author: joeribt
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont hotel is a great place to stay if you want to spend your time in the Greenwich Village and SoHo area. If you don't need Times Square all the time, then this is a great area of Manhattan full of bars and restaurants. You'll get a bit more of "alternative New York" in this area. Washington Square Park is a five minutes walk, and so is the nearest subway station. The rooms are very small and basic but clean. The shared bathrooms are clean as well. For New York standards the rooms are cheap given the location and the price even includes a breakfast, albeit basic. The hotel is quiet, as it has some long term residents who live here as well, so you can relax after a day of sightseeing. Not suited therefore for people seeking to party.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for NYC”
Reviews.Author: EyalWu
Reviews.Content: A simple, clean, choice. Do not expect too much from the rooms - they are rather small, but the are in good condition. The shared bathroom and shower were in perfect condition. The receptionist (Curtis) was kind and helpful, and their luggage store service (free for hotel guests) made my last day in the big apple very nice. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: JBIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget, are traveling alone and you have business in New York, you can't do much better than this. But you should first know what you're getting - and not getting - for $100 per night. Yes, that's all I paid, in Manhattan, for a small, single room with a twin bed. I didn't need anything more than that. It's in a great location, a nice neighborhood and a quiet street. It's also very secure. Separate keys for front door, hall on your floor, and room. And it's clean, including the shared restrooms. So the basics are covered, with kind of a hostel - like atmosphere. No, I never liked sharing the restroom (though like many reviewers, I never actually saw any of the handful of people who were also on my floor). And in fairness, I did have my own sink in my room so SOME bathroom functions are not in a shared space. I agree that the place is old, dated and a little tired looking (see photos). But most people who come to New York don't plan to spend much awake time in their room, anyway. I ended up doing so more than I planned because it was raining cats and dogs most of the time I was there, which limited the roaming I wanted to do. But I also agree that the restaurants in the same block are great. Loved the Chinese restaurant and Burger Heaven just up the street on 6th Ave. I never tried the breakfast in the basement, but I want to say that the desk clerk was always friendly and very helpful. I had to catch an early morning flight at JFK, and was concerned about trying to get out there on time using the subway with luggage, etc. He put me in touch with a great ride service - Eastern. That is the ONLY way to go. They picked me up right on time and I literally made it door to door from the Larchmont to JFK in about a half hour - not kidding - for less than $70. So this was everything it was advertised to be, and a little more here and there, well priced for what you get, and all that I needed. The only reason I might try a different place next time is to see if private baths are really that much more expensive! They probably are.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and brilliant position”
Reviews.Author: 209967John
Reviews.Content: Nice large room with plenty of storage space. Noisy air conditioning a problem and the shared shower/wc a bit irritating. Superb position in Greenwich village. Management very helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: curiouscat101
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Larchmont several times and love the great value and the wonderful neighborhood and convenience of being close to public transportation. The staff is always friendly and the rooms clean. It's a quiet and safe neighborhood near plenty of interesting stores and restaurants. And it draws a nice mix of European travelers as well as Americans. Having the continental breakfast included downstairs helps create a friendly atmosphere with the other guests. If you don't mind sharing the bathroom down the hall (have always been nice and clean) it's a great price for a lovely neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kb277
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent. It is walking distance to subway stops, Washington Sq Park, and the very lively Greenwich Village (New York University is in this area so there are many bars, restaurants, nightlife etc but the hotel is on a quiet street away from all of this). We liked that the Larchmont is located in the centre of Manhattan so whether you are travelling uptown to Central Park / Guggenheim or downtown to the financial district, it is all within reach and not too long. Price: FACT: Manhattan is expensive. This hotel is the best balance between an affordable price and a decent place to stay. Hotel: The service is fine but the hotel is a bit dated and could do with a refurbishment. The rooms are very basic and a little less to what one may expect from a hotel. Our room had a lingering smell of cheesy snacks, which did not go away the whole week we stayed there. The hotel is cleaned daily although there is this feeling that it's not clean (probably due to the dated look / stained carpets). We also got the feeling that there were quite a few guests who were long-term. Breakfast was included but extremely basic in a a small room in the basement. At peak time, there was not enough room. Breakfast is basic: toast, butter, jam, small pastries (not fresh), juice, coffee, hot water. Wifi is provided for each floor and is good.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint but not great”
Reviews.Author: kja12
Reviews.Content: The service over the internet is swift and professional but this place is pretty daggy. The breakfast area is down in the basement and often gets overcrowded. The breakfast selection is very limited and the same every day. For some reason, you can't serve yourself so you have to ask the waitress to lift up the clear lid that covers your selection (which is close to you as it is to her), and then put it on your plate. If she smiled, that would make it better, but one of the women who worked was so unfriendly, it was almost laughable. Rooms are clean and the street is safe and in a fairly good location for the metro. Beds are hard but not thatbad.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJazzA
Reviews.Content: Ok so its a shared bathroom and shower. BUT where is it???? Right next to Bleeker St and Washington Sq Park - so your in the heart of the village. You can walk to everything that you could possibly want and need. Great for what ever - exploring the city or just for staying to the local area. And what a local area - this is the greatest area in NYC. Its a real leafy brwonstone street that has you halfway between 5th and 6th and you can soak up it all. Go to 5th and wander up to the Empire State or down to the park, or go onto 6th and just soak up the atmosphere. Bars, restaurants and everything in between here. At the end of the street is a newsagents where you can get your morning paper or magazine before heading to somewhere for coffee. Then wander to the subway on 7th to explore the city. Come back in the evening and then head a couple of blocks south to the heart of the area and find bar after bar and restaurant and have a great night out. Forgot to eat? Thats ok theres a couple of pizza places open 24 hrs to get a slice. This is just a great place to explore and its cheap, cheap, cheap. They will store you luggage also before your room is ready and for the day after you check out.... brilliant stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, nasty room,scary breakfast attendant!”
Reviews.Author: pinkyjane
Reviews.Content: If you are after a cheap and cheerless place to stay in Cetral NYC this is great, however if you are picky about service and cleanliness, avoid! The hotel itself is located in a lovely green tree lined road in a cetral part of the city with good metro links. The room we stayed was pretty unappealing however. it was dark and dingy with itchy sheets and a grubby carpet. The shared shower and toilet was cramped not very clean. The breakfast was appaling! A very aggressive attendant slapped my hand with a pair of tongs when i attempted to help myself to the paltry buffet breakfast in an overcrowded stuffy basement!! We couldn't wait to get out, thankfully it was only a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but certainly not 4 or 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: Lisahhh
Reviews.Content: Larchmont may be worth the low price considering you get great location, cold AC, TV, WiFi, Robe, Slippers, toilettries, and continental breakfast. However, to me, the dinginess of the rooms, cracked tiles in the bathrooms, stained, grey, bathtub/shower and unfriendly woman in the cafe detract from the Pros. As someone else said, it was okay, but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: WellReadRobyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and wasn't sure what to expect due to the mixed reviews, but we really loved it and it was perfect for us. From check in, the staff were friendly, the porter which helped us with the bags was lovely, the room clean, etc. We never had to queue for the bathroom, in fact we never saw anyone else in our hallway. The location is fantastic. We felt safe and loved the fact that we could easily walk to the metro (although on arrival we weren't sure where we were going with heavy bags, so got a taxi from the metro station to the hotel which was a good decision). The only thing we didn't like was the breakfast. The server wasn't very friendly and the food was a bit disappointing. Just toast or small pastries and coffee/tea/juice. But you can't have everything, and if you're looking for something that's good value, clean and safe, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: etuhs
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great - easy walking distance to a number of subway stations. It's very clean and tidy and well run/managed. The room we stayed in had a double bed and a sink - bathrooms are shared but we were lucky in that they were left clean. We only had to wait once to use the shower. We never had to wait to use the toilet, and so the need to share was not a problem for us. The room's windows looked out onto a brick wall but because were were out and about for 99% of the day, this was not a problem for us. It is not a fancy hotel and I would not recommend for a romantic break, but for a busy trip to New York sightseeing I could not recommend more highly - the cost is very low for NYC and excellent value. I felt very safe in the hotel and the other guests seemed like nice sorts! Breakfast was provided and although not fancy, it was perfectly adequate. I would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, a little basic”
Reviews.Author: Rob4Roy
Reviews.Content: A nice small affordable place near Greenwich Village, Washington Square and Union Square. Very small shared shower room and toilet (down the hall), Three doors and keys to get into the Front door/Hallway and room, yet the windows on the ground floor room did not lock. No room safe. Had a wash hand basin in my room Clean and basic and breakfast included, as was WiFi. Reception staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “frequent guest disappointed this visit”
Reviews.Author: JetLagBoo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Larchmont three times previously. Their rates are excellent for the location (Greenwich Village). Subways and PATH are a couple of blocks away. The only handicap accessible train is a little too far at 14th and 8th so trekking through the neighborhood with large, heavy bags is a mild annoyance but I like being cheap more and refuse to spend money on the cabs and airport shuttles. The quality of rooms is average - flat tv is tiny, no irons or ironing boards. The shared bathrooms are usually clean but make sure to pack your shower shoes. Haven't had any issues with waiting to use the bathrooms but I shower at odd times anyway. I like a firm matress so the beds are too soft for me. I've never tried their continental breakfast because there are so many places in the neighborhood or close by with good food. Staff is friendly and were quick to tidy up my room after Housekeeping failed miserably one morning. I'm not a messy guest so cleaning my room shouldn't be a problem. One morning, I piled my dirty towels, hotel robe, and hotel slippers into one big lump as usual. No bed linens in the lump this time. I ventured off into the city and returned late afternoon/early evening. I found my room in a state of "somewhat serviced". The bed was made but a little sloppily in my opinion. The carpet was not vacuumed so bits of food and random pieces of trishy trash greeted me. My old slippers were placed neatly beside the drawer and a robe was hanging on the hooks near the new towels. This scene was suspicious. Since the carpet was in disarray, I inspected other items for cleanliness. The old slippers should have been carted off with the dirty towels. I had a spare pair as the room came with two clean sets. I eyed the hanging robe and noticed yesterday's stains. I ran my hands across the robe and noticed it was wet. At this point, I was livid and rang the office for service. They're response was prompt and very apologetic. The bellman vacuumed and presented me a fresh robe. He speculated the housekeeping ladies were probably on their phones blabbing with their boyfriends and became absent-minded and hurried. I chuckled imagining his scenario. He apologized once more, asked if the room was to my liking then returned to the office with a promise to notify Housekeeping oof their epic failure. I'll continue to stay here but I will be triple-checking housekeeping's work. I rated Cleanliness a 1 strictly due to my last vist otherwise it would be a 4 as would the rating for Service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vNEILv
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor. The Hotel is located on a beautiful quiet tree lined street a short walk from major subway lines and also Union Square and Washington Square park. Room was very clean and spacious. Decor in the room was slightly dated but it wasn't an issue. Sharing showers and toilets seems a little daunting but there was no one in either when we wanted to use them so it was fine. Room was very quiet, hardly saw another other guests. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a cheap clean hotel in an awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “clean, simple, budget hotel - not a place to spend more time than sleeping”
Reviews.Author: wingg
Reviews.Content: my husband and i spent a few nights here in early november. the pros heavily outweigh the cons, yet i would probably stay elsewhere next time since we were looking for a couples weekend together. this hotel is great for tourists, first time NYC visitors and young people! pros: beautiful neighborhood it really feels like you are going home when you walk down the streets back at night close to subways, 5th ave and 6th ave walking distance to a MULTITUDE of things and the french cafe on the corner has great food!!! clean - but it did smell like cigarette smoke. safe decent sized room for the price no bed bugs, and no recent reports of bed bugs either which we were so worried about travelling to NYC!!! breakfast - we never tried it, but saw it and it looked decent. muffins, juice. cons: very minimal not romantic (in any way! haha!) we could hear the people watching tv next to us not a relaxing room. we woke up and left every day and didn't come back until practically bed time because the room is not really comfy to hang out in. shared bathroom. which was clean, but i was a little grossed out by the steam after another person's shower. but again, very clean. there are 12 permanent residents, which creeped me out for some reason. i could just be a weirdo, but i felt a little like a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Has No Manager and Has Not for Three Months”
Reviews.Author: artworldtraveler1972
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine until I had a question for the manager. The front desk attendant simply said, "I can't do anything, because I know it sounds ridiculous, but we have no manager and have not had one for the past three months." There was no one present who could handle a management situation. The attendant was rude and unreasonable about the request for simply finding a solution to my request. Just FYI.

Reviews.Title: “Want a simple cheap hotel in NYC? This is it.”
Reviews.Author: Angela A
Reviews.Content: I had my reservations about hotels such as the Larchmont, mostly due to the shared bathrooms, however, after looking at reviews on Tripadvisor, I decided to reserve it and hope for the best and I am so glad I did. The hotel staff (with the exception of the lady downstairs during breakfast who had her moments) was very polite and helpful. My room was cleaned everyday. There are two showers on each side of the hallway (with only a handful of rooms) so I never had to wait to use the shower or restroom. I saw them being cleaned each morning and never felt they were "dirty" or gross. The hotel provides a robe and slippers for privacy. The beds are a little hard but not uncomfortable. The hotel is located in a quaint Greenwich village neighborhood; you'll see more families walking their dogs than tourists. It's a very safe hotel and are; I was young, female solo traveler and never felt unsafe. The continental breakfast is less than what you're probably used to at major hotel chains, but it has the essentials (coffee, juice, breads, and muffins). All in all, I loved this hotel. It was just what I needed at a super affordable price in a great location. I've found my NYC hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Helvecio
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine told me about the Larchmont. I was surprise to find that, besides the low price, breakfast is included, the room had ammenities such as a robe, slippers, shampoo, conditioning, soap and washbasin. It kinda feels like living in New York, as we hardly see employees. We get our set of keys and can get in and out anytime. It was very cold in NY and the heat was perfect! I had to use a shared bathroom, but my floor had 2 showers and 2 toilets which were never busy. There were only 7 rooms on my wing. I could take my shower without stress. The room had color TV, telephone, ceiling fan and air conditioning. Whenever I need a hotel in NY, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in New York at this price”
Reviews.Author: jilop
Reviews.Content: Larchmont Hotel on 11th Street between 5th and 6th Ave is an excellent choice at the price bracket of lesser than $130USD. I was half skeptical before arrival but I was pleasantly surprised. The pluses are as follows: 1) great location by bus or subway, though you have to walk for 8 minutes to St 12 or 14 for the subway station. Its also a walk away from Greenwich, Chelsea, Soho and Meat Packing 2) pretty neighbourhood for good quiet residences with tree-lined road, nice! 3) friendly staff who genuinely wants to help 4) decent size room which is clean and well furnished with hairdryer, sink , fan and huge mirror. The radio clock has speakers for your mp3!!! 5) good provisions, including plush towels, decent toiletries and comfortable slippers 6) shared bathrooms are always clean and empty (I wonder why nobody seems to bathe) at all time For this price, I have nothing to complain, even though one night the pipes were rattling loudly but considering how old the building is, its acceptable. One bad night in 7 aint bad. As a tip, get a nice Mercedes limo from NY Limo Trans at (212) 254 6666 to JFK airport, its excellent and reasonable at about 70USD, punctual reliable and luxurious, no hassle. Ask for Suzanne, she is so good a driver. It completes the NY experience. And dont miss the excellent cupckaes at Magnolia Bakery down the road from the hotel on Bleeker Street, you wont regret. Larchmont I will return. I hope they keep the prices and standards. Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved it, I look forward to another visit! Free Wi-Fi was the cherry on top.!”
Reviews.Author: johinne
Reviews.Content: Just home after 4 enjoyable nights stay @ The Larchmont Hotel. From the minute we arrived, (tired and too early for check in), the staff were more than polite, happy and helpful. We were assisted with our bags and luckily our room was available. We had a small double bed room, and yes it was small room, but it was more than adequate for us to operate out of 1 suitcase each, the bed was comfortable, the room had a desk, air conditioning, a sink with two complimentary mini shower gel/conditioner packs, fresh towels each day. There was a wardrobe with bath robes, extra pillows and an extra blanket. Each floor seemed to have it's own wi-fi which worked extremely well. All the bathrooms were shared, but with our room being beside the bathrooms it felt like an en-suite as we never had to wait. The bathrooms and showers were kept well and always had hot water. The area itself is excellent,it has a great New York feel. It has plenty of places to eat, drink, and explore, You are only minutes from a Subway station and overall it feels very safe. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to see New York, weather on a budget are not. You will probably spend very little time there anyway, but the time you do spend will be a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “All about location and price”
Reviews.Author: WSPNYC
Reviews.Content: If sharing a bathroom isn't for you, read no further. But if it's something you can live with, it's hard to beat the Larchmont Hotel for price and location. The hotel tucked into a townhouse on 12th Street in the Village is clean, central to any number of subway lines (among others, three stations along 14th Street and one at West 4th) and inexpensive. My "cosy single" was about five feet wide by 12 feet long, with a bed, desk, sink and television. Perfectly functional and just $90 per night. (The price includes a modest continental breakfast of juice, coffee, tea and other hot-water beverages, breads, and danish.) There were two bathrooms for seven rooms (I think it was) on my half of the fifth floor, and I never had to wait. I rarely even saw another guest. Other notes: The staff was helpful, returning to the hotel had the feel of coming "home" and Washington Square Park is just a short walk down Fifth Avenue. If you're traveling with a group â€” where more expensive rooms don't cost as much per person â€” or if you can monitor room rates over months to catch the occasional NYC deal, or you spend a lot of time on the hotel room, then you might do better elsewhere. But if you're questioning how to make it in NYC while traveling solo, wanting an exceptional location and preferring not to break the bank, the Larchmont is your answer.

Reviews.Title: “European style hotel, great value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1973
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Larchmont and had a great time in Manhattan. The hotel is located in Greenwich village,on a quiet street, a short walk to several subway lines, restaurants and shops. The rooms and bathrooms were clean, and we never waited for a shower in the morning. There were 2 bathrooms on our floor shared between 4 or 5 rooms. The breakfast was enough to start the day, but there is a few places for breakfast in the area, The Waverly was great. They also have safety deposit boxes if you need, and a computer in the lobby. Overall the hotel was great value, staff friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel for location and value if you are looking for somewhere clean, quiet and a great bang for your buck in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: jackhertfordshire
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont hotel is excellent value. Before I went I was concerned about the lack of private toilet and bathroom but they provide a robe and slippers and I did not find the facilities occupied by other guests at any time. Bathrooms and toilets were basic but functioned and were clean. For me the biggest selling point of this hotel is the excellent location in Greenwich village, near to shops and restaurants, yet in a quiet and leafy street. I was in a single room which was small but very clean and perfectly adequate for a short city break. All staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was rather minimal and some fresh fruit would have been welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: neynylund
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 3 times in the same 2-person room 6E2 Hotel -Excellent location in relatively quiet neighborhood. -Restaurants, shops and subway within reasonable walking distance. -Friendly and helpful hotel staff -Pleasant and tidy hotel interior. Room 6E2 -Spacious 2- person room with nice view of leafy street + NY skyline in background -Functional room: large dresser with drawers, night stands with drawers, writing table, alarm/radio clock, flat TV screen, hair-dryer. Free use of slippers and bathrobe -Air conditioning. -Ceiling lamp with fan. -Sink Remarks: -Showers and toilets down the hall (never had to wait) -Noisy air conditioner. Limited ability to change settings -Lack of insulation in walls around air conditioner allows street noise to penetrate room -Super hard mattress on non-flexible wooden slats may cause some people back pain -Unfashionable interior but everything in good condition. -By any standards, ugly floor covering. -Small breakfast salon. Breakfast limited to pastry (fresh) and coffee, juice and tea. Overall score: you get value for your money 3.5 points out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: jahluv3
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel room for a New York vacation. The room is small but who cares, we were out enjoying the city all day and night. We couldn't believe how quiet it was, never heard anyone on the floor and the shared bathrooms were always available. The subway was right down the street on 6th Ave. Great restaurants nearby. I recommend Arturo's on Houston for Italian, The Blind Tiger on Bleecker for microbrews, and Elephant Thai in the East Village. I also left my umbrella at the front desk for future guests, so ask for it if it is raining. I also forgot to mention that the room was clean and no bedbugs!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMcKinnon
Reviews.Content: Clean, Greenwich Village hotel located on a quiet street. (Eleanor Roosevelt lived one block east of the hotel from 1933-42) with a helpful staff. Famous Ray's Pizza of Greenwich Village is located at the end of the block! A five-minute walk to the subway provides easy access to JFK via the A or E trains. Free Wi-Fi is available in the rooms; a computer with free internet access is available in the lobby. Magazines and the New York Times were also available in the lobby. the AC worked; the mattress was firm and comfortable. The TV had the network channels and a few more. The alarm clock worked. The overhead fan was very quiet. The shower, bath and toilet were always clean and easily accessible. The elevator was in good repair. The continental breakfast included toast, condiments, pastries, coffee, tea and juice. I have the impression that the hotel has many repeat visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Save cash here to go shopping with.”
Reviews.Author: quanster
Reviews.Content: Here's the thing. I'm cheap. And I didn't plan on spending that much time in my hotel. Still, I couldn't quite believe how cheap the hotel rate was. How would it be in reality? First off, location. This is incredibly convenient, very centrally located, within short walking distance of a few different train lines. Could not be better. The staff were always polite and friendly. Free breakfast was unexpected. Shared bathroom is fine. There's a sink in the room - I never once had to wait for a shower or the toilet. The room. Well, free internet was a good bonus. It's a small room, like a university dorm, but hey, this is New York, and look at the price. I was happy to have a room at the front of the hotel, a bit of a view from the 5th floor and a look out to the sunny blue sky. But it made it a little bit noisy some mornings. Ah, and one night I really could hear other guests coming in and out of the hall and the rooms. Oh, and my bed. Too soft. My back aches. All in all: I'd definitely come back. If I was travelling with my partner, I'd probably opt for something more romantic and less utilitarian, but for a solo traveler watching his budget. It was perfect. I'm going shopping with the money I've saved by not going somewhere more expensive!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: oliver71_10
Reviews.Content: After a terrible night in a Hotel which amounted to a squeaky bed in a cupboard, this Hotel was a wonderful surprise. Far better than we had imagined from the Publicity. It was clean ,secure,the staff were courteous and professional and the room was perfect . The only problem that we had was trying to figure out the a/c. It was very noisy. If you can master that then you will be able to sleep very soundly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice European Feel”
Reviews.Author: kraftstreet
Reviews.Content: after spending 2 nights in a hostel on the upper west side, the Larchmont was fantastic. bath clean and room immaculate. Continental breakfast was a joke, but as another reviewer noted, a lot of great places in the area. For just over a $100 - this is going to be my go to hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A great bagain. A fun place.”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetical
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont is our "go to" hotel in NYC. We've stayed there a dozen times. What you need to understand is what I want in a hotel in NYC: A clean comfortable room, in a quiet convinient location at a reasonable price. The Larchmont provided me with a large end room with a queen size bed and a desk for my laptop (free Wi-fi). 11th. Street between 5th and 6th Avenues is largely residential and well located for subways and busses. $129 is a very reasonable price for NYC. The bathroom IS down the hall, but it's spotless and they provide bathrobes and slippers. They also provide a true "Continental Breakfast" which means, unless you really need a cup of coffee, why bother. Especially since the neighborhood is loaded with NYC coffee shops, including the Waverly. I consider any day in NYC when you spend more that 8 hours in you hotel room to be time wasted, so the Larchmont is my place. Helpful staff, too. We always eat at Gene's Restaurant at 11th and 6th. It's NYC classic. There are customers that eat there every week. The Veal Chop is perfect, all 12 oz of it. It's worth the price. Stay at the Larchmont and pretend your living in one of the lovely townhouses that line the street.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: sosleepy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night, for the price of 140 with taxes. It met and exceeded our expectations. First, the location is great. fThe Larchmont is on a quiet street lined with brownstones that look like they're straight out of The Cosby show. The subway is a couple blocks away, and there are plenty of restaurants/bars/store/whatever you need, at the end of the block. We got a small double room, and it was very small, but had a little closet and desk that we could put our bags in. The bathroom is down the hall, but they provide a robe and slippers. There is also a kitchen on each floor, with refrigerator. The service was great. Helpful and friendly. They also offer a continental breakfast, but we didn't partake. PROS: location, service, value, free-wifi, robe/slippers, elevator, tv+cable, clean, safe, CONS: very few outlets in the room we will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “At least it was clean”
Reviews.Author: dextervhc
Reviews.Content: This hotel made an okay first impression with me - the lobby looks okay. Unfortunately our room smelt stale and lived-in, it seriously needed airing. We kept the window open whenever we went out to just get some fresh air in. Luckily there was an air-conditioner in the room that we could use when we came back; very hot weather. the corridor always stuck of cigarette smoke; it was obvious the somebody (either a hotel guest or one of their "permanent guests" was smoking inside, despite their smoke-free policy. (This may not bother others so much; I personally can't stand the smell of cigarette smoke). The first thing I did when I went in was check out the bed linen and towels which were snowy white - if not, I would have left. We basically walked in off the street out of desperation as we could not get to the hotel we had booked. There was a sink in the room which was also clean, there were two shared bathrooms for the entire floor, also clean. There was also a kitchen on our floor where we were able to keep food in the refrigerator. I called the desk for and iron and was told they didn't have one, but was informed of the whereabouts of the nearest drycleaner. I have stayed in cheap hotels before and have always had access to an iron. During the night, we could hear a LOT of noise in the hotel, also there was a lot of light let into the room around the door which was opposite the bed. A continental breakfast was included in the price, but unfortunately, if you're like me and don't have much of a sweet tooth, your only option is buttered or plain toast and coffee. Other options were jam, two types of juice and pastries. The good points about this hotel for me were that it looked clean, had an air-conditioner and free internet access in the lobby. However, the smell of the place was just disgusting and I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New York City CAN be affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Tabbico
Reviews.Content: If you can handle a hotel that doesn't have cookie-cutter room decor, don't mind a bathroom down a hall, and don't have a fortune to spend on a Manhattan hotel, the Larchmont is for you. It has modern, European styling and the rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. Don't expect a lot of TV channels or much of the other ammenities that typical hotels offer, but you will get a robe and slippers to wear to the bathroom, a sink in the room, really good air conditioning (it was 98 degrees outside the night we stayed there), and an OK continental breakfast. The hotel is very safe with a locked front door and locked door to the wings on each floor. And the neighborhood is beautiful and quiet. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, excellent location - if you can share a bathroom, consider the Larchmont”
Reviews.Author: Tripperal
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience at the Larchmont Hotel, really no complaints for a hotel under $150 in New York City at the height of summer. The front desk staff was polite and efficient at both checking me in and out. The bellman was also helpful and friendly when, after checking out, I needed my bag kept there and to use the bathroom. There are three keys â€“ one for the inside front door to the main part of the building; one for the hallway (each floor seems to have east and west wings); one for your room. Yes, it's not as convenient as a regular hotel where you just swipe yourself into the room, but it felt secure in an old-fashioned way. I had requested a quiet room not on the first floor and away from the elevators and stairs, and got a third floor room about three rooms down from both the doorway to the stairs and elevator and the bathroom/toilet. It faced the road, but as others have noted, West 11th is a side street and relatively quiet for New York (although when people were shouting rowdily outside, I could still hear). When I called to confirm the booking, I asked about internet access, and the person then had told me that with the small single rooms, wireless access was a problem. However, Iâ€™d read online that lower floors were better, and on the third floor, I had no problems at all. I only stayed one night, so canâ€™t comment on the quality of housekeeping, but my room was clean and neat when I arrived. I checked the sheets for signs of bed bugs, given a few of the reviews here, but they were clean, and I had no problems. The air conditioner wasnâ€™t the most efficient, but it got the job done enough so that I slept fine. The blinds in my room were wide-slat metal, and blocked out the light quite well, better than just regular mini-blinds. I used ear-plugs (which Iâ€™d recommend), and had a decent nightâ€™s sleep. The shared bathroom and toilet were also no problem. They were clean, and I never had to wait to use either. (I only used the shower once, but the toilet multiple times.) As someone else has said, it would have been nice to have a sink where the toilet was to wash your hands, but since there was no towel service there, it didnâ€™t make a lot of sense. It was nice to have a sink in my room; one large towel, one hand towel, and one facecloth were provided. The bathrobe and slippers came in handy, and the toiletry bag had a generous amount of shampoo and conditioner, as well as a sewing kit, although I wouldnâ€™t have minded more than one piece of soap (so that I didnâ€™t have to carry that one piece over to the shower with my facecloth). There was a hair-dryer on the wall, but no iron or ironing board. It would have also been nice, as another reviewer suggested, for a full-length mirror to be placed along the closet door. But generally, I found everything sufficient. I made use of the luggage rack in the closet, the hangers, the desk, and the sink. There were three drawers that were part of the desk, but I didnâ€™t use them. Breakfast was simply toast and various sweet pastries, plus orange juice, apple juice, tea and coffee. However, there are a couple of grocery stores on 6th Ave just north of W. 11th, so I easily supplemented my breakfast with some fruit. I paid $109 + tax (for a total of $128), which I find a good deal at any time in New York City, but this was on a Saturday night the weekend of Gay Pride, for a hotel right in the heart of Chelsea, which made it a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “should be ranked higher”
Reviews.Author: kindviet
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel based on recommendation from frommers. i was nervous about the shared bathroom but that was fine. the only bad thing was you had to go back to your room to wash your hands. i also didnt like having 3 different keys it was hard to remember which key went in which door. i was pleasantly surprised they had a person that helped with your bags. Jane who works the front desk in the evening is very helpful! i would definately stay here again it is within walking distance of Murray's Bagels and 5th ave. the days i stayed there was a lil block party going they had a dunk tank and sold treats WEST 11TH ST is Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend to Anyone”
Reviews.Author: EggerB
Reviews.Content: I just came back from staying at the Larchmont and thought it was great. I shared a room with a friend who has stayed there numerous times and was initially reticent about the shared bathroom situation but it was not an issue at all. First of all, it's obvious that the bathrooms are cleaned frequently; also, I never had to wait to use the shower or the toilet. We didn't even see anyone else who was staying on our floor so it felt as if it was very private. The room was quite small but was clean and had plenty of amenities (hair dryer, air conditioning, flat screen television, robe, slippers, etc). Another bonus is that it is on a very nice, quiet residential street. I've stayed in other hotels in New York City where the street noise was incessant and unpleasant. For the price I think the Larchmont is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the money in NYC”
Reviews.Author: EdKW
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Larchmont half a dozen times over the past several yrs. Great location, friendly staff and clean rooms. Understand that you are staying at a palce with shared baths and you'll see that this an absolutely great deal--breakfast, location, cleanliness. Ed, Key West Fl

Reviews.Title: “Qualified best deal in NYC”
Reviews.Author: roadhund
Reviews.Content: I'm writing to add my rating to the average, because the Larchmont deserves more respect. You must be comfortable with shared bathrooms -- that's my important qualification. This is a fine, modest hotel. The staff is pleasant, the street is quiet, the restos nearby are very good, the location is unmatched, The Village is terrific. Cheaper rooms can be small; pay more and the rooms are very nice indeed with double beds, decent furniture and perhaps big windows facing south (excellent)! The linens are fresh clean white, the showers are cleaned a few times a day. The staff and owners are trying hard to maintain and improve their hotel. I stayed 5 nights in March 2010, and 6 nights in April 2008. They have improved at least some of the rooms, linen appears new, new carpets, better choices at breakfast. And if you're smart, you can park your car on the street for free!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal Considering the City”
Reviews.Author: Mike_8530
Reviews.Content: When one takes into account the ridiculous price of accommodation in Manhattan, little (not so hidden anymore) spots like the Larchmont remain a pretty good deal. In 2009, they've made some incremental but welcome improvements: 1) Online Booking - although I've never had an issue booking over the phone, I used the website this time and it was problem-free. 2) Free internet kiosk for guests in lobby - a small thing, but nice to have. 3) Room refresh - amounts to a coat of paint, new carpet, new furniture (bedframe, desk, bedside table) and new appliances (clock radio, TV, A/C). At this point, the area most in need of work are the bathrooms. Although fairly clean and in operating order, they could use a minor reno at least. As far as location goes, it still can't be beat in my book. You're on a quiet tree-lined street in the central village, far from the tourist hordes of midtown, and with lots of great eating, music clubs & places to explore nearby. Subway access is terrific, with the 6th Av, 8th Av & 14 St lines almost around the corner, and the Broadway & Lex lines only marginally farther away at Union Square. Relatively speaking the 7th Av line is farthest, but it is still only an 10 minute walk at worst. As if that all wasn't enough, there is a PATH station a few blocks away that can get you to NJ if needed. In short you can get to or from any area of the city with ease. Like much of the city, the neighbourhood is safe at all hours. I've stayed here 10 times over the last 6 years and have no complaints, especially since they no longer allow smoking! Yes, there are a handful of residents who live in this former SRO, but they have never bothered me. Based on some of the other reviews, I suppose I'm lucky that I've never had a bedbug experience. I hope that means that management is quick to deal with these pests upon learning of them. In comparison with other cities, I've obtained far more for far less in places like Rome & Venice. Although it hurts, I think it's just the nature of the beast, and let's face it, NYC is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Trainrideaway
Reviews.Content: Having read the negative reviews I think some travellers are expecting a lot for a place that is budget. I have stayed here with the other half two years in a row and not been disappointed...great location, comfortable beds, clean bathrooms (especially as they are shared), quiet, free internet, pleasant staff, inexpensive, near underground. There were also nice other touches such as a toiletries bag, slippers and dressing gown. Why have I only rated room as 3? The decor is a little out of date, and the rooms a bit small with no view. However this place is inexpensive and you could be staying in a noisy expensive midtown with no view!

Reviews.Title: “Okay considering how expensive NY hotels are.”
Reviews.Author: paulquint
Reviews.Content: I stayed six nights, in October, 2009. I'm in my late sixties and long ago gave up sleeping in the backs of cars, etc. I like my bathroom to be in my room when I stay in a hotel. But to save more than a thousand dollars for my week in New York I chose the Larchmont, which is located in Greenwich Village. The area I wanted to stay in, where I grew up. Do I have any complaints? Well, my one big complaint is that hotel fees are so high in New York. In a comparable location in Europe, in Paris, Rome, or Madrid, I know of excellent hotels where I can stay for a hundred dollars a night. In NY - for such a price - you have to walk down the hallway to shower or use the john. I was on the first floor. There were two bathrooms which were quite small, right on the hall. Only a thin wooden door separating the occupant from whomever was out on the hall. Yes, you could hear everything inside. The showers (no baths) were not much different. Tiny stalls right on the hall. One very tight and narrow, the other large and comfortable. But not much space, and, once again, everything taking place within the shower was audible in the hall. The room was clean and comfortable, freshly painted, with a nice small digital TV on the wall. And a bedside radio was available too. But the room was nevertheless dingy. The location of the hotel is excellent, but nevertheless the interior comes across as rundown. Even if the maids do a good job. The staff was helpful, uncritical, aloof in a friendly manner, all in all quite good. The free breakfast in the morning consisted of orange juice (I helped myself liberally - it was good), coffee, muffins, oily croissants, breakfast rolls, and inexpensive fruit pastries. The breakfast room was small, often crowded (many Europeans passing through) and somewhat dingy in spirit. But acceptable. The help was good. This is not a fancy place. If you do not want to hear a gastrointestinal sonata within the john as you pass through the hallway toward your room you may not be comfortable here. Never mind you yourself may make that sonata. My room (with the exception of the clanking of a radiator) was reasonably quiet. All depending upon the kindness of strangers. I could hear my neighbor snore through the wall. But this was only a minor disturbance. And I slept quite well on each of my six nights. The bed was comfortable. So, you get what you pay for. Unfortunately, in New York, the price for a good hotel room is astronomical. I would recommend the Larchmont to anyone who wants to "rough it." If you have to have your own toilet and shower this is not the place to go. PS - I encountered no bugs and didn't wake in the morning bitten, as some commentators have said.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: chaparita
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was in an excellent location, only a few blocks from Greenwich Ave. The bathrooms were small as well as the room itself, but what do you expect for $90/night? The little bag of toiletries (soap, shampoo, etc.) was a nice touch. Free internet access was really handy, altough there is only 1 computer available.

Reviews.Title: “Too Bad About the Bug Infestation”
Reviews.Author: Balonius
Reviews.Content: Very small room, no surprise there. Excellent location on quiet street in the West Village, not far from Union Square hub. Staff was friendly enough. All in all, we'd have been pleased as punch, were we not covered in insect bites. I got well over twenty nasty bites all over my body, including my face, during a four night stay. I couldn't spot any bed bugs, but neither could I see flying insects so I'm not sure what was biting me, except that it was while I slept in bed at the Larchmont. I washed everything we own in hot water upon returning home and am praying nothing survived.

Reviews.Title: “Basic stop over with no frills”
Reviews.Author: marriedmembers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was near our son BUT would not choose it unless looking for a short stop over. The room was basic although clean with complimentary shower gel etc and fresh towels daily. There was cigarette smoke smells on the landing which showed people did not obey the signs. Reception said that some of their premanent guests liked to smoke in their rooms BUT this is breaking the law and fire regulations and should not be allowed. The shower and toilets (shared with 6 other rooms) were very small and required full refurbishment. The single toilet was SO small you could hardly sit down ! Breakfast was adequate although the basement cafe where it was served was cramped.

Reviews.Title: “We were attacked by legions of bugs”
Reviews.Author: seanmclaughlin
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. The staff were friendly. We awoke covered in mosquito, and other bug bites. My partner and I had literally dozens of bites between us. There was a bite on my eyelid, my forehead, between my fingers, on my feet. It was unutterably disgusting. I told the front desk about it, and they were apologetic. The manager didn't find it worth his while to apologize to us however. If you don't want to be itching for days after your stay there, don't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: BenFM
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed at the Larchmont for two years in a row now on holiday visits to NYC, and it absolutely fits the bill for our purposes. Being right on the doorstep of downtown and with good transport links to the midtown attractions/park etc, it is ideal. We have alway found it very safe, easy to deal with, and clean. The rooms are basic size but have some nice extra touches and the shared toilet/shower facilities have never been a problem. Basically, if you are used to hosteling and lower budget traveling then this is a great step up for essentially the same price. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great location and good price for NYC”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDurham
Reviews.Content: This is a European style hotel - bathroom and shower are down the hall. No problems there: clean and unoccupied each time we used it. We liked the neighborhood. This is not a fancy hotel but is great for budget tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Chambaya
Reviews.Content: If you refuse to share a common bathroom on the floor, then this place is not for you. But the showers and toilet areas are all private, immaculately clean and well located. "Common" does not mean there are people showering in the next stall. The individual shower rooms are locked and seldom do you even see anyone on your way back to your room. For $90/night I had a small room facing the front. I could see W. 11th St. from my window! A/C, ceiling fan, writing desk and chair, vanity/sink and single bed. Clean sheets, clean pillows and clean rug. The staff is helpful and non-intrusive. There is continental breakfast but it was served in the basement area and I didn't like the ambience (or lack of it). But this is included for free. Also, a hair-dryer and super clean robe is in each room. I find these things handy since I travel very light. Oh an WiFi too! All in all, when I can walk to Union Sq., SoHo, Washington Sq. Park and Chelsea from ANY location in NYC for $90/night, I would almost sleep on a park bench. Great Hotel and very interesting clientele. Quiet, and nicely decorated. But don't expect the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, safe and affordable budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: MistinguetteS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Larchmont one night a week for four months when I had business at NYU. The international staff is very friendly and helpful; the location is four blocks from Washington Square Park. The rooms are small and plain; some are being redecorated, others are tired, but all are very clean. Let them know if in-room internet access is important to you when you make your reservation. In four months, I only once had to wait (5 minutes) for a shower in the shared hall baths. This is one of the best budget hotel options in NYC, and I plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “dull and a bit sad”
Reviews.Author: bernadetteCo_donegal
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights recently in march.dreary is the word i would use and paid 149 per night per room.there was a party two nights in the cupboard next door . never got to meet reception staff as they are behind glass at reception. lots of locks everywhere which adds to the hostel type experience. breakfast was in a little room in basement with paper cups and plates and consisted of coffee and pastry.reception staff helpful when i rang about anything and doorman friendly but overall we were glad to leave.i would say pretty tacky for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Boerskurfer
Reviews.Content: For a city that is infamous for its over-priced and under-appointed hotel facilities, this place is a revelation. If you are unaccustomed to sharing bathroom facilities, please don't be put off. The ablution facilities are well maintained and not at all grimy. Bathrobes and slippers are provided to aid your modesty and cold feet (literal or figurative). The great proximity to cool (and independent) restaurants/coffee shops as well as transportation (and even a stunning off-Broadway theatre) make you feel like you are in the heart of the Big Apple. It's a real residential area, so the "Las Vegas strip" atmosphere of 42nd street is (thankfully) lacking. Not to mention that it means getting a good night's sleep as the neighbours are intent on doing the same thing. If you have small children or are elderly, this might not be the best place to stay because of the stairs. Access is for the relatively physically able only. If there's better value in NYC, I'd like to know where. I'm a cheap African who loves the vibe of the city, so I'm all ears!

Reviews.Title: “There's A Chest & Mirrors - Shower's Down the Hall”
Reviews.Author: Easty-AU
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, comfortable bed and clean room, all at a decent price. I was visiting for two nights on a backpacker's budget and a friend recommended the Larchmont. Glad he did. Checking in I was reminded of a line from a Robert Cray song - 'There's a chest and mirrors, the shower's down the hall'. But having lived in college dorms, and given I wasn't expecting the features of the Hilton, sharing a communal bathroom was no big deal.
