The hotel is close to the subway (W.4 St. on the blue line, 14 St. - Union Sq. on the yellow/green lines, and 8 St. - NYU on the yellow line) and is a short walk from friendly and cheap bars and restaurants in Greenwich Village. The continental breakfast was minimal - a danish or croissant with tea/coffee/juice - but at these prices that's to be expected. If you're looking for a cheap and relaxed base for your New York adventure, I'd have a look at the Larchmont.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: jcmiami
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Larchmont Hotel at least 10 times over the last 10 years. I have stayed there primarily for price and location. It is on a gorgeous street between 5th and 6th Avenue in the Village. The street is quiet and lined with Brownstone buildings and trees (think Sex in the City streets on the show!). It is close to subways as well and everything in the Greenwich Village. Unfortunately the hotel has kept the same decor and has not been remodeled, revitalized nor maintained well throughout the years. During this last stay, the room's furniture, rug and bed spreads were looking extremely worn and old and the rug stained in many areas. The mattress felt lumpy with a rather deep indentation where all the previous people slept on. The room also smelled rather stale and stuffy. The window blinds were bent and broken allowing light in. The TV had almost no reception at all and the WifI simply did not work period. The hot water heater made A LOT of noise all night long. The bathrooms were not up to the standards of before where they were incredibly spotless and cleaned constantly, now I found hair everywhere and also some mold. Luckily the toilets were very clean! Due to these recent experiences, I will not be returning here. With the competition of new "budget boutique hotels" opening everywhere in NYC, this hotel is not worth it anymore. The hotel need to be seriously overhauled

Reviews.Title: “Back home at the Larchmont”
Reviews.Author: branners
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Larchmont and, as always, we enjoyed it. I flew into NYC from a business trip in the Middle East, where I stayed in a US$620-a-night hotel and I can honestly say I liked the Larchmont better. Perfect location, safe and secure street, and great service at the hotel, led by the always-smiling Gustavo. Our room was large enough and, even if the furniture is modest and dated, we were always comfortable. We never had to wait longer than 2 minutes for a bathroom, and we met a number of friendly people in the elevator and in the breakfast room. We have no complaints about the breakfast; good coffee, great OJ and a nice Danish, just the thing to start the day. We have no hesitation at all recommending the Larchmont to friends, or anyone who wants a bargain in a great location in NY. Donâ€™t expect it to be the Trump Towers, embrace the experience and enjoy the city!

Reviews.Title: “Give the breakfast a break”
Reviews.Author: ElyetteNess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Larchmont (travelling alone) in 2006 and was quite impressed by what it was for the price (4th night free at the time). I went this month (Nov 2008) with family (baby included!) that is used to staying in nicer hotels but were a bit put aback by the prices of NYC. The hotel can really use a freshing-up, this would really make a difference! But the staff was as lovely as ever, I don't agree on the negative things said on the breakfast (the coffee & juices are good; true there is only one pastry offered but its either a very generous & tasty moist muffin (blueberry or banana), or croissant or pain au chocolat of a good size. This makes a difference as this runs over $10 in the city(muffin + juice + coffee + table) , and also saves time. The clientele (both times I went) were very pleasant - usually Europeans or other travellers that are willing to put up with some lack-of-comfort for more $$ to spend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for experienced NYC traveler”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy0000
Reviews.Content: Ok, first the bad: rooms small, shared baths, dated furnishings, short on charm. Now the good: great neighborhood, safe, good value for the price. Have travelled to NYC numerous times on government per diem, numerous times on personal dime. Have stayed at Larchmont maybe 4 or 5 times (on personal dime, of course). The reality check: That good hotel you pay $150 a night for out in wherever USA costs you a minimum of $350 a night in NYC, so its important to understand what you are getting when you decide to stay at the Larchmont. If this hotel were located in any moderately priced city in the country, no one would stay there at this price; in NYC though they stay booked year round. There's a reason. It's not great, but it's a lot better than anything else within the same price range. The key to enjoying your stay there is to manage your own expectations and pocket the $400-$500 you don't pay over a weekend when you stay elsewhere in the city. Is it the end-all-be-all? No, but considering NYC prices and quality, it's good enough. It is the least expensive place I am willing to stay while in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: travellinmccoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Larchmont in September 08 for my Birthday weekend. The price was good and considering most of us who go to the city don't worry about sleeping too much as there is too much to do. However that said, although the room was fairly clean if not small, I think there are better deals for boutique hotels to be found. We'd stay again but would try our other favortie spots first.

Reviews.Title: “Great value+service, but be aware of drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: TGHouston
Reviews.Content: This place is a great value on a (relatively) quiet street (for NYC) in a good neighborhood (Greenwich Village) with a lot of good options within walking distance. The staff are very friendly and helpful. But be aware of the drawbacks before you stay: -Many rooms are internet wi-fi dead zones, and I even had problems keep a reliable connection in the lobby (very frustrating). -7 rooms share 2 bathrooms in each wing of each floor. I never had a problem getting a shower or toilet when I wanted, but be aware that your room will only have a sink and a hair dryer. Fortunately, bathrobes and slippers are provided for the bathroom trips, as well as a bag of shampoo, conditioner, soap, and a shower cap (and a sewing kit - do people really use those?). In one slight piece of cleverness, even if both showers are occupied one toilet will still be available (the shower and toilet have separate lockable doors/microrooms in one of the bathrooms) -Your door will not latch without the keys, so you have to take your keys with you (and lock your door) on every trip to the bathroom - unless you just want to leave your door wide open. -Speaking of keys, you will have to carry 3: to the front door of the hotel, to your floor wing, and to your room. Odd, but you'll get the hang of it quick. -Water temp can sometimes vary during a shower, and they're so small it's hard to avoid the scalding/freezing. -This may sound minor, but it's extremely cheap and annoying: the thinnest toilet paper in the world on rolls that lock after a half-rotation and break the sheets. Did I mention annoying? -The breakfast is so cheap, you're allowed to pick *one* bread item only and get a *single* drink refill. It was enough for me, but is this really necessary? I assume they had problems with the cheap tenants stockpiling... Like I said, it's an amazing value for Manhattan, but be aware of the "roughing it" aspects before you get there and the experience will go better. Advice: book early, it's small and fills up fast. While (trying) to use the wifi in the lobby, I heard a phone call every few minutes answered with "Sorry, we don't have any availability on those dates." They really need web site reservations, if only to keep their employees' sanity from the barrage of phone calls...

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to NYC and second great stay at the Larchmont”
Reviews.Author: bradv98
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Larchmont over New Years in 2004 so when we visited New York last month we stayed at the Larchmont and once again the hotel was perfect. We stayed on the second floor and our room (a small double) was clean, quiet and quaint, and the bathrooms on the floor were very clean and we never had to wait. It was a very hot week in NYC so the fan and air-conditioner in our room were both much appreciated. The hotel location is great - walking distance from many great restaurants in Greenwich and East Villages, 2 blocks from the subway, and only a few blocks from the cool Union Square Greenmarket! We would most definitely return - recommended highly.

Reviews.Title: “was fine, location superb, bathroom a challenge!”
Reviews.Author: susanNewOrleansLa_
Reviews.Content: We were two ladies on a pleasure trip to New York, and felt very safe in the neighboorhood at all hours. Found the subway within a few blocks, and enjoyed walking and eating in the neighborhood. Don't miss the Forbes museum around the corner. We had a good room since it faced the street front. My first time with a shared bath, but I never had to wait, and though very old , the facitities were always clean. Saw no bugs of any kind! The lift was slow, and inconvenient to the basement area where the free coffee and muffins were served each morning. Saw more of a European clientel there; they seem more tolerant of the lack of amenities than most Americans. Considering the price of a weeks stay I would definitely stay here again and put up with the bathroom situation. Not for everyone, but the money we saved was considerable, and I suspect we got one of the nicer and larger rooms. This will not be your type of place if you are too fussy, hurried or need a lot of privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.....Shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandUK34
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Larchmont many years ago and having a fantastic experience, this trip came as a huge disappointment. Bell staff lovely, unfortunately our room and shared facilities were a complete disgrace. Although smoking has been banned for some years our room smelt of stale smoke and damp. The blinds in both windows were broken, and the carpet was sticky! The bathroom was a complete disgrace though, the shower plug hole was so blocked by hair that the bath would fill with water, on one trip to the shower, there was blood over the floor and toilet, I complained immediately to reception who said they would have it cleaned, when returning to the shower half an hour later, someone had been up and wiped the floor and toilet with a towel that they then left behind the door! After numerous complaints the shower was finally cleaned on our final day. The location is great and although we had a great trip it was ruined by the thought of having to return to the hotel at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Best in central location we found for the price”
Reviews.Author: fuffzsch
Reviews.Content: This was was best deal we could find for our stay in Manhattan. The location is excellent for exploring the southern half of Manhattan (either by foot to greewich or east village) or by subway from union square just about everywhere. Getting home by cab at night is affordable from throughout downtown. Its a quiet and safe area. My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights, paying 119$+tax per night in August. We had a small room to the back with shared bathroom (right next to it actually). Shoes and a coat were supplied. The room was clean, AC worked nicely (but was a little noisy). We were quite content with the room (as we knew it was not going to be big). Criticism is only that it was near to the floor hallway's entry door, and I was woken in the middle of the first night by other people coming back to their rooms. Also, wireless lan was not working in our room (but in the lobby and the breakfast room). We didnt complain about this. The shared facilities were always clean (cleaned several times a day). Still, its shared bathroom and shower, which is not for everyone!!! Breakfast was in the basement. It was ok (cinamon roll or muffin etc, plus coffee, orange juice). Free New York Times was lying around which was very convenient for planning the day during breakfast. So overall, its a good deal for the location. If you find anything cheaper, I guess you have a very good deal or be looking for a youth hostel.

Reviews.Title: “It's got the NY Style!”
Reviews.Author: anisdiaz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for what you pay! Location is just perfect if you have only a couple of days. The manager is an awesome guy, really nice and with the NY spirit! Breakfast included... not bad! Me and my husband had a great time. (beds maybe too little, shared bathroom wasn't a problem at all... clean and spacious)

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dana78
Reviews.Content: I stayed in New York in 2006 for 6 nights, a beautiful experience if I would not consider the hotel. Loooking back now, I am aware that 120 USD/night (the paid price) is very low for Manhattan and for the convenient location of Larchmont (in Greenwich Village, nice, quiet, more European style) and that you will not get anything better for this money in NY. However I was very disappointed and felt that the advices on traveladvisor are a little bit overreacted when giving great marks to this hotel. I was a little bit worried about the shared bathroom, but this was not a problem, at it was quite clean. Problems were: - the smell in the hotel - the tiny rooms with no natural light (we had a huge block 1 meter or less from our window so we were barely able to see something outside or to catch the sunlight) - the old furniture in the rooms (I guess they were refurbished somewhere in the '60es) - the extraold A/C which made a lot of noise (made me feel somewhere in the dessert of Mexic, not in the stylish NY) - the horrible breakfast (1 muffin and 1 juice or 1 coffee- tried it once, never returned back in the basement for breakfast) Again, maybe you pay the location because otherwise I would not give half the amount for a hotel which in my opinion does not deserve even one star.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location. Cute hotel.”
Reviews.Author: StanLaurel
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to Union Square which now seems to be a happening hub in NYC. Also convenient for the subway as just a few blocks down you can get the train that takes you directly to the AirTrain to JFK. (A much better way to get out of the city, not to mention far cheaper than a long bumpy taxi ride to the airport.) Close to Greenwich Village too. And within walking distance of Chelsea and the art gallery district. If anybody knows of a better deal for a hotel in such a great location then please let us know as I looked all over and couldn't find one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Best Deal in Manhattan!!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyManNYC
Reviews.Content: We had family visiting from LA and couldn't fit them in our tiny village apartment so we put them up at the Larchmont. The Larchmont is on a beautiful tree-lined street surrounded by brownstones and some of the best shopping and restaurants in the Village. It's near all train stations and just a ten minute walk from Soho, it was TOO easy to go shopping. Their room was comfortable, elegant and clean, they'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a short stay in NY; great location”
Reviews.Author: brelwen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Larchmont. Location is great, right in the Village, about 5 min. walk to several subway lines. It's also near the Bleeker St. area, where there are good restaurants and great jazz/blues clubs. The hotel is on a quiet side street, and the other guests were discreet, so it was surprisingly calm compared to other places I have stayed at in NY. If you stay at the Larchmont I would recommend you request one of the queen rooms that face the street. Our first night all queen rooms were booked so we had to stay in a tiny room with a double bed on the ground floor - definitely not good for chlostrophobics (no room to move, a window but facing an inner courtyard so very dark, faint cigarette smoke odor from the other side of the courtyard). However, the next two nights we stayed in a queen room facing the street on one of the upper floors - it was barely $20-30 more expensive, but made a big difference. The queen room was spacious, with huge windows and plenty of light, and the NY skyline in the distance. Great! Rooms were simple but clean - it is not a luxury hotel but a great, convenient place for someone on a budget for a short stay in NY. Bathrooms are all shared (rooms just have a sink). There are two full bathrooms per floor, and there was never a wait to use them. They were a bit dated, but spotless. The hotel offers breakfast, included in the room price. It is served in a little cafe-like room in the basement (still has a window onto the street). Breakfast was simple but good - juices, tea/coffee (no decaf), and choice of one fresh pastry per person. All hotel staff was friendly and helpful, except perhaps for one of the breakfast ladies who must have had a bad day once. Overall, this hotel is great for the simple traveler - nothing fancy, but comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday ruined (bed bugs)”
Reviews.Author: tasteofhoney1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Larchmont last week, in one of the fairly large queen rooms. Location is super, prices fair enough, and I personally I don't usually mind the relatively shabby budget hotel with shared washrooms if it is in a great neighbourhood. It is reasonably quiet and clean-seeming too. However, I must say that the previous mention of the bed bugs is absolutely for real. I was practically eaten alive with large welts appearing all over my arms, shoulders, and abdomen. We know for sure it was bed bugs based on seeing some in our room and the nature of the bites and the secondary allergic reaction I had. Our holiday was pretty much ruined -- much of it spent hunting down cortisone cream and antihistamines and rebooking at the Holiday Inn on Layfayette St. Management at the Larchmont was very stingy with compensating us. At least we had good weather!! Until this hotel gets the pest problem under control I'd recommend staying away. Side notes: our tv didn't really work and the breakfast is just pastries so isn't really doable for more than one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired rooms; need a facelift.”
Reviews.Author: citysqaure
Reviews.Content: I wasn't that thrilled with my experience at the Larchmont; the bell staff were excellent though. My room was so tired looking; the metal blind on my window should have been replaced years ago. It was a bent and in bad shape. The floor in my room sunk in a few spots and the furniture look like it was from a cheap motel in Hawaii, circa 1970. The breakfast was not healthy; no yogurt or fresh fruit or cereal; just big sticky buns and croissants and muffins. The location is excellent,, I just felt that the rooms could have been much nicer. I wasn't crazy about the shared bathroom; but then I had never tried it before. The toilet was in a room the size of a broom closet and the shower was really really old but it worked fine. Anyways I guess when you stay in NYC you really need to lower your expectations as you can't expect the same value as you might in less travelled cities.

Reviews.Title: “Room was small but comfortable, very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: freyastark
Reviews.Content: An ideal location. A bijou hotel on a quiet street. More European in style than North American. Small ,comfortable ,quiet room. We shared bathrooms but they were impeccably clean. Helpful, pleasant staff. Good price. Elevator. A very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Smoky - Dangerous - Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: jhorsfieldbradbury
Reviews.Content: We were staying in NY over New Year's Eve, and wanted somewhere in the village. The location is great - close to Union Square. The price was reasonable, but there were just too many negative aspects to the hotel. They don't have any non-smoking rooms (or didn't - I'm sure not sure the law changed). Thus, our room smelt very smoky. After complaining, they gave us a de-ionizer thing, which didn't do any good. There was a pipe that carried hot water in the corner of the room - this was boiling hot at night, to the point where one of us got a burn that blistered from touching it briefly. The room was small, smelly, and the showers weren't great. One of the worst hotels I've stayed in. Looked good from the outside. The name sounds nice. That's it.

Reviews.Title: “Grows on You”
Reviews.Author: DidiIndiana
Reviews.Content: My friend often stays at the Larchmont on trips to New York, so she recommended that another friend and I join her there on a recent trip to Manhattan. She warned us about the shared bathrooms/toilets (there is a wash basin in each room, I believe) and the small rooms, but praised the location and price (for $700 total for four nights, Wed through Sun noon, three of us shared the queen-sized room, two in the queen bed and the third in a roll away bed). I was the first to arrive and liked the look of the place--a street full of brownstones and little shops--but was a bit put off by the locked door into the reception area, where the staff was encased in bullet-proof glass. It took three keys to get into our room on the fifth floor (there is an elevator): one for the door into the entrance hallway, one for the door from the landing onto your floor, and yet another, of course, for the room itself (which is double-locked). But they come on a plastic bracelet, so it was easy enough to keep track of them. The reception area and halls look vaguely European, but the decor of the room itself reminded me of Florida--a long time ago. I went out for a walk before my friends arrived, and the location IS terrific: between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, four or five blocks up from Washington Square, near grocery stores, shops, bus routes and subways. I bought some things like cheese and beer back, which we kept in the fridge in the little kitchen on our floor (quite a few long-term residents stay at the hotel, all of them very friendly). The longer I stayed at the Larchmont, the more I liked it. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful (storing luggage for you, letting you have breakfast even if you're a little late, offering helpful advice and information). My friends and I enjoyed meeting other guests of all ages from Europe and South America, and the diverse staff as well. I've recommended the Larchmont to other friends, and will certainly stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: P.Grazini
Reviews.Content: The location was great, mid block and quiet. We stayed in a small double the first night and upgraded to a large double for 4 more nights. The difference in the two rooms was great. We paid about 10 dollars more for the large double and it was definitely worth it. Nice to have breakfast included. The bathrooms could be nicer. For the price, I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Larchomont: Surprise! Hidden Gem, in West Greenwich Village”
Reviews.Author: ADCS
Reviews.Content: For my friend's birthday, we decided to stay overnight in NYC because she wanted to shop in Greenwich Village's funky boutiques. We're from suburban Fairfield County, CT; you can understand the need for something other than mall stores. Our requirements:: Affordable, safe & very clean, great location for shops, restaurants. Winner! Very affordable (total for 3 of us for 1 night: double occupancy/ queen bed + $10/rollaway + taxes = $187.10), We were in Room 6E2, with window overlooking street. Check in is 3 p.m. /out 12:00 noon. Can store bags. Other properties in the area but most were pretty expensive or required more than one night's stay. Price also included continental breakfast of O.J., apple juice, coffee/tea & 1 muffin or other pastry. "Cafe" located in the basement but was bright and cute; 8-10 a.m. We went down late; they were nice and let us in. The Larchmont is located on "one of the most beautiful streets in the Village" (27 West 11th). Very true. March 8, nothing is in bloom, but really is a very pretty street; in bloom, it must be even better. We kept admiring the architecture. Guests have to share bathrooms down the hall w/other rooms. We were assured by the hotel that the bathrooms were kept very clean. Roe was VERY nervous about the situation as she ONLY stays in 4-5 star hotels & only will stay in a B&B if private, in-room bathroom. Jean & I are more intrepid depending on destination and it doesn't bother us to go down the hall for a bathroom, but we've never stayed in a place where we had to share with other rooms. Tthe idea of SHARED bathrooms, kind of made me nervous, too. (We skeeve easily at hair, unwiped tubs, etc.) Happy to say, tiny but spotless bathrooms (shower & toilet only, sink in room), never a wait, we didn't even see anyone else. By 8:00 a.m. maid was in cleaning them again. Clean rooms/nice fresh scented sheets; carpets probably should be upgraded. (Has A/C and TV) Be aware: this hotel's rooms are small, like European ones/or cruise ship. Also, being in a 100-year old building, when the steam heater went on it was a bit noisy "puuuhfffffftiiittt" "shhhhh" periodically through night). Also, that night wind was whipping so we could feel a breeze through window with a/c. I'm always cold, but with the steam heat, not a problem. Plenty of closet & drawer space. Hair dryer & towels (regular size, not huge, extra big ones, though) in room, cute toiletry kit for each person. White robes/shower slippers (sealed)-like in a spa- for each of us. Prompt, friendly staff -brougt up rollaway & my robe/toilietries/towels right away- stored our bags upon arrival so we could shop. Note: for bigger breakfast, walk to corner & eat at French Roast, is not expensive; good food, very busy. Safe neighborhood; we walked back from Villa Mosconi on 89 McDougall St. at around 10:00 p.m. Noted several European guests staying at Larchmont, which for me, makes it more interesting and fun. Roe commented that she would definitely stay here again (!); so would Jean and I. Great for girls weekend; couples, mother/daughter weekend. Close to NYU, Union Square. Reallly nice change of pace vs. staying in mid-town NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and very affordable”
Reviews.Author: mjfmiami
Reviews.Content: This was my first time ever staying in a hotel for a weekend trip to NYC, and it was a blessing to find the Larchmont. For the price, and the location, it cannot be beat. The staff did not make me feel uncomfortable or disposable as I'd feared given the fact that it's so budget. Rather, they behave like well trained hospitality people, which makes a difference as a single woman traveling, because it helps for greater security. I'd recommend this place as a real find to anyone who needs a quick and easy place to rest and to leave their belongings while enjoying the city.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, but can you complain for the price?”
Reviews.Author: tarichard
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to complain about The Larchmont when you consider the price (and I got the four nights for the price of three offer too). But I have to admit I was a bit culture-shocked at the state of the place when I went to my room and wondered if I could actually stay here for four nights. It *is* clean and they *do* provide sealed slippers and a clean bathrobe for the journey to the bathrooms and walking about the room but nothing escapes the fact that this is a battered old place that needs fixing up. The wood work (doors, windows etc) is scuffed and chipped throughout and is in desperate need of filling and painting. The tiling and grouting around the sinks and showers is ancient and grimy. The bedside clock had all sorts of dirty marks on it. It all adds up to give you the impression that there's 20 years of other people's filth in your room and you don't really want to touch anything because it's just old and dirty. But can you complain at this price? On the positive side, and I did stay my four days and ultimately felt more comfortable going to sleep there, it's really cheap for New York, I found free wireless internet access in my room (provided by somebody else's unsecured wifi network - thanks guys), it feels safe, the staff are friendly and you get breakfast of sorts thrown in (if you eat carbs for breakfast). But all the reviews that rave about this place are doing so because of the price. If you take that out of the equation then it's not so awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I have ever stayed in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NYC_LOVER_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Larchmont many times over the past several years ever since they opened. I have read the reviews and have never experienced any problems at this hotel. The staff is always pleasant and the rooms are wonderful (small, yes, but clean and always comfortable). I have never had any issues with the availability or cleanliness of the bathrooms, never had any bed bug issues. I completely love this place, it is located exactly where we want to be and the price is right. Don't pass this place up. It is really a great, inexpensive place to stay especially if you are only showering and sleeping there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place”
Reviews.Author: chizzle
Reviews.Content: We are extreme budget travelers so we have stayed in some crazy places all over. This hotel is great. It smells like cigarette smoke in the hallways but that is my only complaint - also it's a smoking hotel, so can't blame it for the smell. The staff are professional and the location is fantastic. I would stay here again ( and I am actually going to soon!)

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: luvbuz
Reviews.Content: I am very late in writing my review, but want to throw it out there anyway. I stayed here with my boyfriend at the end of April. We only stayed two nights, as we were en route to visiting family. Thank goodness it was only two days! At the low rate, I wasn't expecting much. The room was small, but clean. The worst part, as many others have commented on, was the lack of hot water. No one said anything when we checked in, even though there had been no hot water for days, according to other guests. We were alerted to the fact from the signs posted in the hallways. The bathrooms were also not cleaned regularly. The dirty towel that was in the bathroom when we checked in was still there when I left after 2 nights. On the positive side, the location is fantastic. The subway is nearby and the neighborhood was very safe. I really hope they get things together; it would be a great budget place to stay if they can work the kinks out!

Reviews.Title: “Very positive overall experience”
Reviews.Author: eugrif
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Larchmont with from Dec 5-10 and we were a bit apprehensive after seeing horror stories (especially about bed bugs). Spent the first few hours trying to hunt for bugs but to no avail and neither of us were bitten during the stay. Staff were fine, breakfast wasn't great but fine if you are on a budget. Small double was big enough for us. Room was old but clean, or clean but old. Carpet and furniture had seen better days but replacing them would obviously put the price up. Showers and toilet again, old but clean. Alternately or even simultaneously friendly/cantankerous bellman Carlos was amusing and a friendly Trinidadian lady served us breakfast. Did have some problems with TV but with what passes for programming on channels we could see (50% adverts) dont think we missed much. Radiator stopped working on day 4 but never really got too cold in the room to complain (we were out all day). You can use the wirless connection in the lobby (which we did most mornings) but not in the room (at least not in the one we were in 5W3) which worked well. All in all staff were very efficient and we came away with a good feeling about the place (especially compared to some friends of ours, also from Barcelona who stayed in the Holiday Jnn, paid double for room only and felt a bit cheated)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Larchmont for 5 nights beginning Dec 2, 2007. I had no major problems with this hotel at all. The location is great. It's in the middle of Greenwich Village, close to 2 Subway stations, trendy restaurants, cafes, a drugstore, and easy to get to. The neighbourhood is safe, and I had no worries walking to and from the hotel at night. The front desk personnel was professional in checking us (3) in, and were courteous, even though we arrived close to midnight. We did not experience any problems with the elevator, although it is small. I chose a "spacious single". There was ample closet space, and the room was clean, and comfortable. I'll admit the radiator took some time getting used to, but once I figured out how it worked, there was no problem with the heat in my room. The shared bathrooms were clean, and always functional during my stay. They are not "gym style", so only one person can use the shower or toilet at a time, and there are about 2 washrooms per wing. All in all, I had no problems in getting a w/r when I required one. The hotel also provides a robe and slippers for each guest to use on check in ( located in the closet). Security is excellent. There are security cameras, and due to the set up of the hotel, you need to use TWO keys before you even get to the front door of your room. They provide a continental breakfast, but I did not partake in that, so I couldn't comment. The ONE thing which I had a quibble with is the fact that they do NOT accept reservations electronically. So, once you decide you want to stay here, you have to phone, or fax the dates you want. I recommend phoning your dates, and then having them fax a confirmation. Still, if it keeps costs down by doing this way..I'm all for it. As for costs, for a single room, you are paying from 89-99 dollars a night. For everything that is provided, you could NOT ask for better accomodations. The staff was professional, the rooms clean, if not small, the facilites in working order, and clean as well, and the location was great. I've been to NYC 10 times in the past 6 years, and I can honestly say that for the money, this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable deal in Greenwich Village”
Reviews.Author: Henrik L
Reviews.Content: Considering the price and the location in a quiet Greenwich Village street, the Larchmont is a great deal if you only want to sleep in your hotel room. We did. The staff is friendly if you talk to them - no more, no less. Our room (double queenbed, 109-120$ per night) was small and somewhat worn out but clean and bed and bed linen was ok. Toilets and shower in the hall was worn out but clean. Avoid the sweet miserable continental breakfast at the hotel and find a cosy diner on Av of the Americas.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Cyclist
Reviews.Content: Our stay over the Labor Day weekend this year was unacceptable. Which is sad since we enjoyed our stay a year ago. And it seems obvious based on other reviews that the Larchmont has slipped. It is with sadness that I write this bad review. Why? The location is fantastic -- on a quiet street between 5th and 6th ave. And the price is great. But they aren't the only low cost alternative in nyc -- hotel 17, 2nd home 2nd ave are a couple of places I've stayed that I would recommend ahead of larchmont. Now for the bad stuff. On Sunday, I got up to go to the bathroom at 6am. One of the two shared toilets down the hall was totally clogged, the door was open to the hall, was smelling up the hall and disgusting. I used the other toilet and when I got back to the room called the front desk. They said that the cleaning person started at 7am and would fix it. At 7:15am, i went down the street to get a bagel and saw no sign of a cleaning person. I stopped by the front desk on my way out and reported the toilet in graphic detail. I was told it would be fixed. When I got back upstairs, no cleaning person. I used the other bathroom's shower with a smell that was inescapable. Got back to the room. Called down to the front desk at 8:15am and again reported the toilet. I was told this was the first time they heard of this problem. (I had spoken to 3 different people in two hours!) Again I was told it would be fixed. My fiancee took a shower and as she was leaving the bathroom the cleaning person showed up. But the best part was, that she started on the working bathroom and the not the clogged one. My fiancee says that something bit her during the night too. I didn't have this. Based on other reviews of no hot water for days, broken elevators and our experience with the toilet. Management just doesn't seem to care. I don't mind the small room. I don't mind the bathroom down the hall. It isn't actually an issue of money for me. I like the neighborhood and see the hotel room as a place to sleep and shower and if we are spending more time than that in the room, we aren't spending our time in NYC correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: btaylorNyc
Reviews.Content: Bed Bugs. Got three bites in a few hours of sleep there. Nothing worse than bed bugs at a hotel. ITs an absolute nightmare waking up in the middle of the night now to check and see if any followed you home.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay In This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SanDieg0H0me
Reviews.Content: Please be advised that I stayed at this hotel 10/3 - 10/14. My room, 5W1 was infested with bed bugs. I had to deliver live bugs to the front desk to convince them I was telling the truth. The hotel manager Mr. Khan was completely unsympathetic, made no apology and after moving me to 2 other rooms at great inconvenience, only was willing to credit me for 2 nights stay. I've reported them to the NY Health Department and the Better Business Bureau. Note that since bedbugs lay eggs in your luggage and clothing, I had to put all clothing in the my washing machine, including the articles I was wearing immediately after arrival home and spray my luggage with bug spray before ever entering my home so as not to infect it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good really!”
Reviews.Author: Piwakawaka
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel earlier this year when it was getting more favourable reviews than it has been for the past few months. I watched in horror as our holiday loomed and review after review provided tales of bed bugs, widespread dirt, and poor service. Imagine my relief when we finally got to the Larchmont after an 18 hour flight. It's fine! When you're paying US$120 a night for a room, and you're in an absolutely prime location for everything you could wish for - restaurants, numerous subway lines, character-filled streets as well as a central point from which to explore the whole of lower Manhattan - it's pretty churlish to complain about the less satisfactory aspects of the hotel. Yes, it's got worn furnishings, dirty carpet and the stench of stale cigarettes throughout. Yes, the showers fluctuate from scalding hot to icy cold in milliseconds, the air conditioning units sound like freight trains and the breakfast consists of day-old pastries. But in our opinion it was really good value, as long as you're willing to put up with those relatively minor issues. if you're not, it's best you stay elsewhere. Showers and toilets were always available, the beds were really comfortable and we fould the staff amenable, though not entirely friendly. We would stay here again, unless we won the lottery and could upgrade to somewhere fancier.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great; functional but needs cleaning.”
Reviews.Author: Suzuki267
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much, but I don't see how people can give this place anything more than 2. The room was tiny, but that was part of the deal. Washroom shared, also part of the deal. But the fan, air conditioner and carpet looked like they had not been cleaned in over a decade - dust, grime, filth. Elevator had moving blankets hung that were overwhelming with mildew smell, and they stayed there for all three nights for no apparent reason. Air conditioner also smelled mildewy, but less so. Breakfast is laughable donuts or danish and bad coffee, and not worth the trip to the basement. Bed was okay, linen on bed, towels and bathrobe/slippers were clean, but spare pillow had hair all over it - obviously they just don't check. Place smells like an old rooming house that is trying to appeal to vacationers. Which is probably exactly what it is. Shower had tiles falling off, was dark and the shower room was tiny with no space to set anything. Like your key, towel or housecoat. On the plus side, location is good, close to Union Square, the Village, etc. Street is nice, seems a safe neighbourhood. Staff were friendly enough but obviously too ill-compensated to really care too much about making the place nice. Price was cheap, but I've heard better things about the Y or a hostel. Slippers were a nice touch, but absolutely essential considering the condition of the carpet. Next time I'd stay at a comparably priced B & B in Brooklyn and take the train. It's a shame, because if they just vacuumed, dusted and cleaned a bit I would give it at least one more if not two more stars. So, take shower sandals and asthma medication for the mildew and dust and you'll be fine. It was cheap, safe and the sheets were clean, but beyond that not much.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: IzziB
Reviews.Content: Came back from New York city a week ago. I was staying at Larchmont hotel and was not disappointed. I booked a single room for three nights which was located on the 5th floor, east side. My room was tiny.. but I had all I needed inside: a sink, clean towels, a robe & slippers. The lady at the front desk was very nice as well as the bellboy (from Peru) who helped me out with my very heavy suitcase. I had breakfast one morning in the basement.. the juice was good and the muffin warm and delicious. It is not a very welcoming place but it is enough to start your day and it is free. I never had to wait to use the shower and the robe & slippers came very handy. I could not use my air co the first night and had to call the front desk. Someone came to my room to help me out and make it work. They were always nice & helpful. I can only recommend this hotel. The location is great.. you walk 5 minutes and you reach Washington Square & Mc Dougall street with a lot of nice restaurants & bars in the area. I would stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: genegenie68
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site I made a reservation at the Larchmont and went in with very low expectations. This place follows the truism that you get what you pay for, but, frankly, I don't want to spend a lot of money on accomodations since I don't spend much time in my room when I'm traveling. As others have said, I'd rather save it for a good NYC meal, which is what I did. My main criteria are 1) is it clean? 2) is it in a safe neighborhood and 3) can I get a good night's sleep? The answer to all three of these was yes! As others have also said, location, location, location. I went up to Times Square to see a couple of shows and couldn't wait to get back to the Village. More locals, less tourists. Convenient subway stops nearby, a short walk to Washington Square Park and lots of yummy eats in the neighborhood. If you like veggie food you must try Gobo on 6th Ave at 8th St. French Roast on the corner of 11th St and 6th Ave was also a great place to start the day. I didn't bother with the continental breakfast at the hotel. I reserved the small single and was on the 4th floor east. I had read that the small single was a bit like a cell so I was prepared for that. Yes, it was very small but that was OK. Thankfully, the air conditioning was in working order since it was hot and humid when I arrived in NYC. The bathrobe and in-room washbasin were very nice. The room was clean enough but it did have the faint smell of cigarette smoke. I noticed that there was an ashtray in the room and realized I hadn't thought to ask about their smoking policy. I'm pretty sensitive to scents and it didn't bother me too much. There were people in the room next to me and I could hear their tv blaring when I was in the hallway but was very happy that it didn't disturb me in my room. The bathrooms were always available and clean. They're not in the best shape, cracked tile, stains, etc, but they were clean and I felt very comfortable using them. I had no problems with the front desk staff. They were very nice and helpful whenever I had to interact with them. I would definitely stay at the Larchmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PULAOKHAO
Reviews.Content: This is reasonable budget hotel for New York, where hotel rates are very high. If you are expecting the Ritz, you will be disappointed. If you come with reasonable expectations for a budget hotel, then you won't be disappointed. details at [--] PRO: Location, within reasonable walking distance of Union Square subway; provides robes & flip-flops which almost no other budget hotel provides; reasonably quiet location for New York; reasonably clean; stayed on 4th floor East; had small kitchen with sink & fridge but no dishes or utensils; seems safe with 3 locks before you get inside room. Provides toiletries: soap, lotion, shampoo, sewing kit. Small color TV in every room; some of about 15 channels may have audio/video problems but enough choice to watch TV for few hours. Enough shared bathrooms that never had to wait for one to be free CONS: singles are very small rooms; rickety bamboo furniture in room; old hotel in need of refurbishment; expect worn carpet, etc. Plenty of restaurants in all price ranges within a mile of hotel BUDGET TIPS: WHOLE FOODS GROCERY STORE right across from Union Square Subway; you can buy sandwiches, salads, etc. at reasonable prices & picnic on Union Square across street; pharmacies like Rite-Aid give reasonable price of things like fruit juice, etc. Remember New York is one of the most expensive cities in USA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: psasquatch99
Reviews.Content: I just got home from a great stay at the Larchmont Hotel (Stayed 2 nights 13th & 14th of September, Room # 1W2). After reading previous reports on the rooms with the shared baths, I reserved what they have lists on the web site as a â€œFamily Roomâ€� ($199 & $229, total with tax $492.23), because of the rate I thought the room would be little more than a walk in closet, but for the rate I mentioned, I was willing to gamble. In my humble opinion the gamble paid off in spades, first the positives: (1)Location, itâ€™s located on a fairly quiet street two blocks north of Washington Square Park (which I think is the coolest neighborhood in NYC) (2)A Nice Sized Room, (see photoâ€™s) there were two separate rooms both small, with 10â€™ ceilings (3)What looked like brand new window AC units (one in each room) and both rooms had ceiling fans. (4)Both rooms a small flat screen TVâ€™s (5) Good size closet with robes & slippers, four sets of towels and extra blankets and pillow And now the negatives (and when I say negatives again in my opinion these are all very very minor issues): (1)They only give 1 set of keys and it takes 3 different keys to get from the street to your room (2)The rooms only had 1 twin bed and 1 single with a roll out under it (3)Small chest of drawers (but a decent size desk with drawers in the front room, but all furniture seemed to be new and in good condition) (4)There was construction going on right next door (started a 9:00 AM) (5)Itâ€™s a little bit of a hoof to the subway stations (3ish blocks down on 6th or 4ish over to Union Square park) The bathroom: (1)Small but adequate (see photoâ€™s) (2)Good supply of toiletries (good quality soap, shampoo, conditioner & sewing kit) (3)Instead of a small little shelf or having to use the toilet tank as a shelf they have a full size mirror medicine cabinet over the sink The staff: (1)Other than check in/out (we got to the hotel at noon expecting to just drop the bags, but they had the room ready and checked us in) and having to ask how to find my room and how the locks worked (god did I feel like and idiot) I did not have any contact and cannot speak of any rude behavior (2)Chamber Maid, did a nice job on my room (clean and neat, no complaints) (3)They do offer a continental breakfast (did not partake so I can not give an opinion, but it did sound a little goofy that you had to go to the desk show your key and then they would take you to the breakfast room) Again, in my opinion there is no reason not to stay in this hotel, as in previous post I would stay away from the rooms with shared bathroom, though the price is attractive. Next trip to the big city you can bet I will be staying at the Larchmont on West 11th.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: DuckLola
Reviews.Content: The disaster began upon making our reservation. The person who took our reservation was very curt and seemed like she had better things to do. When we tried to check in at 3:00, we had to wait for them to finish cleaning our room. The hallway had a strange odor and when we got to our room the cigarette smoke overwhelmed us. The bathrooms were reasonably clean. The window overlooking the shower was covered in paint meant for privacy but somebody had chipped away part of the paint so one was exposed to neighbors across the way. We felt violated. Our first day there we were not provided with a privacy/cleaning request door sign to alert the staff that we needed new towels etc. When we went to the front desk to request one of these that other rooms had hanging on their doors they simply gave us a plain piece of computer paper to hand write out our request and tape it to the door! It was ridiculous. In addition to this we did not receive any clean towels, once again being forced to make an unncessary trip to the front desk. Fortunately housekeeping did bring us clean towels shortly after this request. Television remote did not work. When we checked out they didn't make us feel like our stay was valued. Overall I would not recommend staying here unless you are basically strapped for cash.

Reviews.Title: “Filfthy, Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: livinwithmcs
Reviews.Content: Ok folks, after reading the reviews I was prepared for basic accomodations, etc. I have got to tell you I was deeply disappointed. The lobby is decieving, it's the only clean place in the hotel. This place is filfthy!! Run the air conditioner if you dare, it looked like the filter hadn't been changed in years. Obviously the management does not take any pride in this property anymore. There were so many layers of dirt on the carpets (in the corners) and the shared bathrooms are run down; cracked tile and the toilet had feces stains down the front that stayed for a number of days. I really don't know what the housekeeping staff does here. Also there are some type of bugs because we kept waking up with bites all over. I will admit the staff was more friendly than I anticipated, however it does not make up for the deplorable conditions. The only plus is the price (you get what you paid for) and the location which is amazing. Bottom line is this place is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “why stay Midtown...”
Reviews.Author: ejbm59
Reviews.Content: this is usually where i stay when visiting the city and, to be perfectly honest, i don't know why people love to stay mid town or uptown which in my opinion is too touristy and congested to navigate. The Larchmont is located on a quiet residential street between 5th and 6th ave in a gorgeous old townhouse with a dramatic entry and staircase. the room decor is dated tropical style rattan, but now dears, you can't have everything! it's very conveniently located to either 14th or 4th street subway stops on 6th ave. you can easily walk to the shopping mecca of SoHo. this area of the village is where many fashion industry folks and actors call home. visiting fashionistas with hawk eyes for celebrity watching will love it (eg: the Bergdorf Blondes author and Vogue-ette Plum Sykes blabbing away on her mobile phone in front of Citarella, clutching the latest "it" handbag). to really appreciate how much better looking some actors are in real life, just sit while sipping your coffee and watch the likes of Matthew Modine strolls down 6th Ave past Joe's Diner. to stock up on toiletries i always head straight to Bigelow Chemist down the way for esoteric euro brands. this hotel does not get high marks for decor or outstanding guest service, but as they say ....location location location!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but dirty”
Reviews.Author: EandF_Kelley
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: Location and price were great. 3 blocks from subway. Quiet street. Towels and sheets appeared clean. A/C worked. Hotel provided robes and slippers for shared bathrooms. Bathroom was always available when we needed it. Two bathrooms on our floor: One had a shower, stall combo. The other a separate shower and stall. NEGATIVES: Room needed some serious cleaning. Dusty, dirty, sink had a slow drain, poor reception on television, low lighting. Had to purchase an air freshener for room. Shared bathrooms were dirty. A non-smoking facility that smelled of cigarette smoke. Breakfrest was not worth the trip down. Great breakfest place right at the corner of 11st and 6th Ave called French Roast. Over all needs some serious renovation, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Dump, but cheap dump”
Reviews.Author: paulde
Reviews.Content: After scouring these pages for somewhere to rest my head for a few days, I eventually opted for this place, which was among the cheaper options available. As others have noted, the best thing about it is the location, a tree-lined street in West Village, with easy access to town. I've stayed in worse places over the years, and it certainly has plenty of character, but in truth this gaff is a real dump, which needs closing down and converting into flats. The staff are those that refuse to engage in conversation and insist on answering the phone while you're attempting to talk to them (I soon gave up with the pleasantries), and the 'breakfast room' is rather like a bunker in Baghdad (I passed the breakfast up in favour of the many splendid cafes in town). I would not stay here here again unless strapped for cash.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: CoolCop47
Reviews.Content: Had some reservations about the stay, especially with the shared bathrooms, and the cheap price, but after staying there for 2 nights, all was well. If you want bells and whistles, don't stay here.....if you want a nice, clean place, then the Larchmont is the place to stay. Located in a very nice residential neighborhood, close enough to the subway, and surrounded by bars, pubs and restaurants. We stayed 2 nights, and was very pleased with the hotel, would recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: al4048
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, That is the reason my husband and I will continue to book it. But, this hotel is filty. The bathrooms are very dirty and the rugs in the rooms are hardly vacuumed, the sheets are wrinkled and I question just how clean they are. Where is the manager of the cleaning crew?

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: Iwouldratherdie
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks quaint on the net and from the street, step inside however and it's hell. It smells of a combination of industrial strength disinfectant and urine. Along with the nursing home theme, the mattress has a plastic cover. The door to the room locked but the key would not withdraw. The air conditioner didn't work. The ceiling fan did but it wobbled at such a precarious angle I feared decapitation. The shared bathroom was more like an abandoned summer camp latrine than a place you would go to get clean. You would come out feeling dirtier than when you went in! The power points were behind a bookcase (that was near to collapsing) and the bed. You had to move the mattress to to plug in. The internet connection only worked in the lobby - apparently. It never worked in the few hours I was there, which made it hard to find another hotel, which is what I spent all my time doing. When I checked out they seemed shocked. "But you've just checked in!" I started to list the horrors but gave up and just said, "I'm not happy here."

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: ggg5312
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 days in June. The decision was made based on good reviews in TA. We reserved the queen size room which is pretty roomy for NY. There were a lot of hangers in the closet which is quite rare in the hotel. This was our first time of staying at a hotel with shared bath. The shower and toilet were always available when we needed. I had to fix the flapper in the commode many times during the day so that the water can fill up the tank. This is a budget hotel so we did not expect much. We did not try the coffee and muffin at the hotel. Each morning we walked to French Roast for our breakfast. The area was very quiet and peaceful. The staff was okay, typical big city people, not rude, not friendly. We like Carlos the bellman. We are not sure whether we will go back again. I like to have the bathroom en suite. However, it will be a while before we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, quirky”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid T
Reviews.Content: Overall, great value for money, although there are a few quirks. Location is on a beautiful, leafy street, near several subway stops. Most of the front desk staff are extremely helpful. Rooms are very small, but spotless, and had everything I needed - alarm clock, hairdryer, sink, TV, telephone, and desk. Wireless access was patchy on the 4th floor where my room was, but worked great in the lobby, which is a good place to hang out, check email, or read the paper. There are lots of little restaurants in the area. If you want something more substantial than the free breakfast offered by the hotel, Joe Jr's Restaurant on 6th and 12th has inexpensive diner fare. French Roast on 6th and 11th has gourmet coffee and fancier breakfast offerings. Famous Ray's Pizza on 6th and 11th has great NY pizza by the slice. One tip - you may want to bring flip-flops to wear in the shower if you are all squeamish about things like foot fungus!

Reviews.Title: “Survived!”
Reviews.Author: trabelpro
Reviews.Content: We also went with out hot water -for a whole week (April 21-28) They told us when we checked in it would be on the next day...but didn't get any all week. A problem with the gas...they fixed it, then needed a city inspection....waited....failed the inspection....fixed it....waited....and then we left. Location was great - between Union (great subway stop) and Washington Squares. Street quiet. Air conditioner worked. Queen room was quite large for NY. It would appear that double room would be quite small. Room on front of hotel had a great window looking out on street. Only one person at the desk was rude. They were in a tough spot with people complaining about no hot water. We walked about 4 blocks to the YMCA to shower. Halls smelled of smoke but our room didn't. Great location, fairly clean. Shared bath no problem for us. Some one mentioned a shared kitchen. I did find one, but wouldn't have used it. It appeared to be for people who live there for a long period of time. Queen bed was comfortable. Got extra pillows. Breakfast was in basement. TV was on all the time. We only went once and from then on just took some coffee back to our roon. There are to many good breakfast places to spend time in the basement with a TV! If Iwent to New York again, I think that if I possibly could I would spend a little more and get a nicer place if I could find one with as good a location. But could stay at Larchmont again. Probably the hot water situation could happen any where. Some great little restaurants on McDougal street off Washington square.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended budget option - possibly haunted!”
Reviews.Author: V&J2003
Reviews.Content: I've given this 4 stars because its great value and cheap for NY. Its a budget option however, and you should be aware of this. Its in a lovely street full of brownstones and the hotel itself is part residential. The room was comfortable enough, with cheap wicker furniture and a sink. The first hotel I've ever stayed in where the room door had a spy hole and chain! Despite this, the neighbourhood felt pleasant and safe. Breakfast is simply a coffee and pastry in the basement - you may want to go out for something a bit more substantial. The shared toilets and showers are small and old, but perfectly clean and nice to use. The hotel provides robes, towels and a few toiletries. The heating came on during the second night and the old radiators made a terrible racket - clanking and hissing! It was very alarming! Although the hotel has a website, you have to book by phone - you can't email. My husband (who is usually sceptical about such things!) had a fright when he thought he saw a figure at the end of the corridor (our room being the last one along there), which gave me the shivers!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto on great value!”
Reviews.Author: WriterJohn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Larchmont twice: once in a single room and once in the queen with my wife. This, for New York City and the West Village, is an incredible value. Never had to wait for the shared bathroom, the staff is helpful. The only drawback is the free breakfast: It's not worth the "price," which is to say, "skip it."

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: beezie2
Reviews.Content: we stayed for four days and it was a typical case of 'you get what you pay for'. the room was clean, the shared bathrooms were always clean and available, but the service and food stunk. i don't agree with previous posters that the staff were friendly, the front desk attendant at my check in and check out (2 different people) were talking on the phone to friends for a full five to ten minutes as I stood there, waiting to check in/out. location is also OK, there aren't many places to eat nearby that my husband and i were interested in. it's all greasy college kid food.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: lillau81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room, the beds were very small. When I asked for blankets we received something like a large piece of felt. I never had a trouble getting to use the bathroom even though it was shared. The free breakfast was questionable (I didn't bother with it after the first try). The staff are very helpful and friendly. It is in a good location, a short walk to explore Greenwich Village and to the subway. It is a budget hotel so you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review of the Larchmont”
Reviews.Author: Bud75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Larchmont a few days. The biggest plusses are location and price. This is a great neighborhood, walking distance to many restaurants, movie theaters and all major subway lines. When in New York, we go from morning to night so we don't spend much time in our room. We therefore look for a hotel that creates a comfortable, safe environment where we can get a good night's sleep. For the most part, the Larchmont met this requirement. The one significant negative for us was the lack of non-smoking floors. At times our hallway smelled pretty bad. We could pick up the smell in our room sometimes. Our room was pleasant otherwise. It had everything we needed. The shared bathrooms would be a potential problem for some people. They are small. We never had to wait though. It appeared that they were cleaned frequently. The sink in our room helped. The staff was friendly and helpful. No complaint there. We didn't try out the continental breakfast. They didn't have decaf coffee so we headed to French Roast at the end of the block on 6th Avenue. The diner at 6th Avenue and 12th Street was also good. Overall the Larchmont is a good value. We'd go back if the hotel would create non-smoking floors.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Quiet and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: redbrid
Reviews.Content: My daughter (13) and I stayed at the Larchmont for 9 days on a recent trip to explore the city. For the price our experience was great. The Larchmont's strengths are its location, it's great prices and the quiet rooms. We never heard a car horn or street noise from our sixth floor room. The beds are comfortable, as are the cotton robes provided. Murray's bagels around the corner is THE place for breakfast and the lovely neighborhood on 11th st really makes this a great value lodging option for those who don't need large and fancy rooms or a private bath.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bbbuttons
Reviews.Content: Just the location is great. It's close to everything you could need. All the staff was friendly. And the rooms and washrooms were always clean. After a long day of running around the city, it was great to go back to our room and relax. When we go to New York again, we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay at the Larchmont”
Reviews.Author: car22
Reviews.Content: Larchmont was very pleasant and comfortable. No problems sharing the bath though the toilette and shower on 5th floor were very small. A large person would have problems. Hotel is located on 11th Avenue in Greenwich Village. Very pretty street with trees, flowers and walk-ups. Excellent but inexpensive restaurants nearby. Skip the hotel's complimentary breakfast and try the French Roast Cafe at 11th and 6th Av. My idea of the perfect NY neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “great location, pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJButt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in Oct 2006. Paid extra for a queen room. A great location on w 11th street near Was Sq, NYU and the subway. Lovely quiet leafy street. Pleasant staff. Breakfast uninspired. Room looked out onto street, leafy view, plenty of storage space. Bathrooms pretty basic but never crowded. A good "budget" stay in NYC. Tip--get the nice room--we saw into a single room and it was cell-like.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location”
Reviews.Author: dkahn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Larchmont for my first visit to NYC. I was originally going to stay a few nights and then stay with a friend in Brooklyn, however once there I stayed there the whole trip. The location is great - central, you can get everywhere from there and is near the 14th st. subway station which is one of the larger stations/hubs. As for the hotel, the bottom line is that there is a good feeling there, nothing dark or negative. The staff is friendly even on the phone when booking, the rooms are clean, basic and perfect for anyone who plans to be out in the city most of the time. As for shared baths, it was not a problem. Only on one day did I have to wait a few minutes to get a shower because both baths on my floor were occupied. Also note that my room had a sink in it (I am guessing most rooms have this), so that made things easier too for shaving, etc. Anyhow, I recommend the Larchmont. Not sure it can be beat for the price, location and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location!”
Reviews.Author: nomad23
Reviews.Content: Best location in Manhattan. Cosy rooms but great value for money. Shared bathroom was spotless and never busy. Everything was clean and had no complaints. Would return every time I visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “It's all true”
Reviews.Author: klompen
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to previous reviewers; great location, friendly staff, home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Budget Stay”
Reviews.Author: bethwit
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont was a pleasant surprise. The staff was charming and helpful. The rooms were small but well equipped, clean and very comfortable. There were extra blankets and pillows, an in room hairdryer, and the slippers and robes were an especially nice touch. We never saw anyone or had to wait for our shared bathroom, which was clean and efficient. All in all, I cannot wait to go back again. The breakfast is a little odd, you have to ask for muffins and then there is a "one a day" policy (imagine Seinfeld's soup nazi with baked goods). But, hey, it's free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Price and Location are Excellant!”
Reviews.Author: dudek48
Reviews.Content: Location was wonderful, on a beautiful street and walking distance to Union Square, Washington Park. Many nice restaurants/bars/delis and grocery stores nearby. Rooms are small, furnishings were clean but aged, and the bed was very comfortable and clean. Extra pillows and blankets in our rooms. Bring some extra hangers, we had to double up on some hanging clothers. The breakfast was very good, lots of coffee and big cinammon rolls. There were two couples in our group, and we were very pleased with the price, location and service. We stayed there for one week, and the rooms and bathrooms were cleaned daily. Weather was perfect outside and air conditioners and ceiling fans worked very well in our rooms. Next time, we will reserve a queen room, located in the front with a view of the street. I wanted to post some pictures, but didn't take any of the interior of our room but the ones posted of the outside of the building are very accurate. Our next visit to New York is already being planned and we will stay at the Larchmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: STD1960
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont features very clean, safe, dormitory-style rooms, suitable for the traveler who wants to see NY on a budget. The location is perfect for those wishing to be in the very heart of Greenwich Village. The continental breakfast consists of coffee and pastries, defraying the cost of a morning meal and the hotel is within short walking distance of dozens of affordable NYU eateries and pubs. While you have to share a bathroom and shower with three or four other tenants, they are well-maintained and kept consistently tidy. Book well in advance, as this gem is in high demand, especially on the weekends. I've stayed here on several occasions and recommend it without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: davidraph
Reviews.Content: This is as much a resident hotel as a guest hotel; thus there is no service mentality among the staff. Similarly, common areas such as the lobby are locked and there are numerous petty rules. My room was not as small as other reviews have described, but its furnishings were inexpensive and in only average condition (the bed was particularly bad). The shared bathrooms are what you might expect in a 100-year-old YMCA -- clean, but very institutional and uninviting. Really, the only good things about the place were its location and the view of neighboring townhouse backyards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: garysutherland
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont in Greenwich Village is a nice little hotel on a nicely treed street away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan but you can be there in 5 minutes with the subway. The rooms are small but clean, The washrooms are down the hall and they were kept clean. The staff were very helpful. The prices for the rooms are great. Next time I would get the room with the Queen size bed as it was much larger that the room with the double bed. The complimentary breakfast was good enough to get us started in the morning. The hotel is close to restaurants. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, small, and acceptable”
Reviews.Author: msu_tripper
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location; price as compared to other Manhattan properties; quiet nice tree-lined street; easy to get to from LaGuardia (Q33 bus to Jackson Heights, F subway, stop at 14 st/6 ave, walk a few blocks); loads of books in room; sink in room makes shared bathroom bearable; A/C; robe and slippers (too small for size 12); blow drier in room. Cons: Small somewhat shaby room, tiny shared shower with shower head on the side of a bath tub (never had to wait, though); no clothes iron in hotel; 12 inch TV with few channels sitting on low stand that makes watching in bed difficult (didn't watch much, but still would like a little better); kitchen on our floor (2nd) had no cooking utensils; tiny breakfast in cramped 'cafe' which can only be accessed by door man's key. Could not see staying more than a few days. Probably would not return. I'm 6ft 2in and it was all a little too small for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Would Return”
Reviews.Author: coffeerocks
Reviews.Content: We are from Edmonton, Canada and I was in New York the first week of July 2006, with my 18 year old daughter and her friend. I booked this hotel because of the price , the location being in Greenwich Village and the reviews it received on Trip Advisor. I also read alot of reviews on Trip Advisor before booking this hotel. There may have been less expensive hotels or hotels in the same price range with your own bathroom, but these places also seemed to have issues with bugs, dirt or noise. The Larchmont is on a quiet street and we had no problems with noise inside or outside. We had a queen room with a cot and the room was an adequate size, and reasonably clean. The bathrooms (2) and showers (2) down the hall were always available when we needed them, although the mold on the ceiling of the shower room and peeling paint should be tended to soon. Quite honestly, I expected a bit more in the appearance of the room and bathrooms, but after a few days of settling in, it was fine. We always felt safe in the hotel and on the streets in the general area. It was a great location to stay in and I would return to stay in the hotel. I would highly recommed going to the Lower East Side Tenement Building that is being restored. It is an actual tenement house from 1863 that they are restoring, and just walking down the narrow street you could imagine what it must of been like in the early 1900's with pushcarts and children playing on the streets! Although we are from Canada, it was still a wonderful and emotional piece of history on the life of immigrants that most of us can relate to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Finbar_x
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights in Aug 2005. Excellent value. Our room was a little small but clean and quiet. We shared a bathroom down the hall but never ever saw one other person on the floor, so never had to wait. Good breakfast too. And the location is ideal. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: buzzlnj
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont is one of the very few budget hotels in the Village. It's located in a very nice quiet street a few blocks from Washington Square. The hotel itself is ok, the room was clean but extremely small. The bathrooms in the hallwall were very clean at any time of the day. The breakfast room in the basement is a bit gloomy but you're 5 minutes from the heart of Greenwich Village with lots of lovely cafÃ©s!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for cheap. High security hotel! You need three keys to get in and you need to know how to jiggle them. The bathrobes and slippers make us forget that we don't have our own bathrooms. Bathrooms are always clean, available (2 for 5 rooms). A/C is great to have and works like a marvel. However, crew may turn it off while you are away. Room gets very hot. Morning time is quite funny with the ''bread nazie'' in the basement eyeing you while you eat your only allowed muffin. Don't even think about asking for a second one! Also, breakfast is only served under close escort by the hotel crew (elevator doesn't go down there unless accompanied by authorized personnel). I guess this way they save on muffins! Elevator is a little tiny and may be scary at times but we had a great time going up the six flights of stairs. Seriously, this place is very good and cheap for the area (we had a queen bed on the sixth floor with view for about 150$ a night taxes included). Close to all the main attractions and subway. We highly recommend it. We surely will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M-Polo
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont is in a great location... very close to the action in Greenwich Village. Two different subway line/stops are only 5 minutes and 8 minutes away. The breakfast in the basement is forgettable but there is a cute French restaurant/cafÃ© 2 minutes away..on a great corner with large windows overlooking the cool street scene .The double room was big enough to fit an extra cot. The street is very fashionable. Bathrooms down the hall are very basic but acceptable. We would return there. Just dangle a cheap nonstop airfare in front of us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Larchmont”
Reviews.Author: tischclan1
Reviews.Content: So pleased with our three-night stay at the Larchmont. The room was quaint and charming, more like a bedroom than a hotel room, and looked out on the townhouse- and tree-lined street (little traffic at night which is a huge plus in NYC). The room held a desk, dresser, TV, closet, queen bed and sink with plenty of room to spare. Window A/C turned to fan setting was perfect as a white noise provider at night so we didn't hear a thing, no neighbors, no cars, nothing. The toilet room down the hall was tiny but very clean and never occupied when we needed it. Ditto the shower room, very small, but wear the hotel-provided robe and you won't have to deal with where to put your clothes while you shower. Clean towels in our room every day. The old-style elevator was clever but we enjoyed hiking up the three flights several times daily to help work off some of that good food available in the neighborhood. Joe Jr.'s breakfast place on 6th is amazing and cheap. Subway is about 3-4 blocks away at 14th and 7th (??). French Roast a half block away looked good and was always drawing a crowd. The most unexpected fun for me was seeing celebrities hanging out in this area, walking on the streets, in stores, etc. Many live in the West Village/Greenwich Village/SoHo area so keep your eyes open if that kind of "sightseeing" interests you. Overall, really cool location, friendly help and a charming room made this stay outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Amyfrank
Reviews.Content: We like the Larchmont for price and location. Quiet and lovely street. Near NYU and Cooper Union. Rooms are big and roomy and can even fit a cot. Comfy bathrobe and slippers for all guest to shuffle to shared bath and WC.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont is a no-frills hotel with 'rustic grandeur' situated in a bustling neighbourhood full of Brownstone buildings. The upgraded Queen room we had on the 6th floor faced south down Manhattan and was large, comfortable and quiet.
