The shared bathrooms were never occupied and we were never disturbed in any way during our 6 night stay. Breakfasts comprised of juice, coffee and a Danish and was adequate to set us up for the day. One member of staff amused us particularly by her capacity for serving the buns whilst directing her eyes towards the tip jar (it really is taken for granted all over N.Y. that they do not have to earn their tips!) Also, when I asked the night receptionist for a corkscrew she informed me that a previous guest had not returned one and offered me no courteous advice on where to acquire one; if you were amused like me by these examples of 'inhospitable' hospitality providers then this hotel will suit you fine. Jefferson Market provides the best deli in the Village, Rays Diner provides bountiful cheap food all night ( say hello to Gregory and the Mexicans who gave us free desserts), good restaurants, 13th St. theater and a cinema and the subway 10 mins walk on 6th and 14st provide amenities within strolling distance. Empire State building and Flatiron are 25 mins walk and Chinatown and Little Italy the same in the opposite direction. A very pleasant hotel with a distinctive New York brash charm in a great neighbourhood - book as soon as you can!

Reviews.Title: “good......but”
Reviews.Author: brizzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. We could have checked out as our reservation was only for 3 days. We didn't check outonly because of the location. It is on a nice side street and steps away from greenwich and we like to walk. Had it not been march break and everyting was full then we may have reconsidered. Good points Roomy for price and nyc. Clean Bad points Here we go.... The place feels like they are cutting as many corners as possible. Our bed was not good until we realised that the matress was upsidedown and the pillowtop was facing down. There was no heat for a while. We threw the covers over the bed one morning and they decided that that was good enough and didn't make the bed that day. Contenental brekkie is ONE MUFFIN ONLY. One of the toilets on our floor is so small you have to sit sideways! The doormen wish they were somewhere else when they have their hand out.......If you know thesefacts you can enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “value for money but ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: room was a bit cramped but furnishings nice. however there was a VERY strong perfumed smell on all the bedclothes which gave me a sore throat and nose and made me head for a similarly priced but more comfortable hotel pronto

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised to find a hotel in the West Village this cheap. It was clean and quaint. The staff was accommodating. The location was perfect. I did have to share a bathroom, but they were always vacant and clean. Great for travelers on a budget. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. We were to attend a cocktail party for a friend at Ascension Church Parish House across the street and discovered this little gem. It is not the St. Regis. The rooms are quite small, and yes the baths are down the hall, but it is immaculately clean and very quiet. It's main clientelle are young European couples on a budget, and yes, they know the meaning of value at $89/night. One problem with the facility is the myrad collection of keys one is issued upon arrival. And the breakfast room with it's strict bread nazi who gives you the evil eye if you dare ask for more than one roll. Still a wonderful location that is clean, inexpensive and well-placed. Will be back. BTU

Reviews.Title: “Why go uptown....Great inexpensive little hotel in the heart of the village”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont is a wonderful little hotel in West Village. Very neighborhood feeling area...Sesame Streetesque......... Building is secure, only those with a key can get in beyond the front hall......need another key to go to your floor, and another to your room.... Rooms were average size, the Queen was spacious while the double was small... on the whole what you would expect for average $120 p/n and we weren't going to be there but to sleep...spent our savings elsewhere. Arrive early and the courteous staff will deliver your bags to the room later...Rooms have tv, but no plus cable, clock radio, AC (kinda noisy)old?? Room in general and linens were clean. I loved the bathrobe and slippers, clean, soft and white, which you will need in the night if you need to go to the bathroom as it is down the hall...Rooms only have a sink and med cabinet...Still there are approx. 7 rooms per floor we had ample access to the 2 baths,(adjoining) one toilet only, while the other has bath,shower sink and john....Old 1940's?? but clean...Doors lock, no problems here.... There are residents but I saw no one that I could pick out as a resident from a tourist... Breakfast I previewed but chose to skip as it was pretty meager, coffee rolls, small muffins and coffee, tea and juice... Would definitely stay again....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money - clean, cheap and a good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my teenage daughter for 5 nights. We wanted somewhere clean, cheap and in a good area and we got exactly that at this hotel. Our room was old but clean as was the shower and the toilets and they were spotlessly clean throughout our stay. The only time I minded the toilet being down the hall was in the middle of the night - but in all the time we were there I never saw another person in our hallway or had to wait for the shower. Breakfast was minimal but adequate and again the area we ate in was clean. The staff were not over friendly - but we worked on them and they at least smiled ocassionally by the end of our stay! The hotel was in a really attractive tree lined street in a nice part of the city and convenient for everything. I would definately stay here again - we were out all day and only really wanted somewhere to sleep. I'd rather have more money to spend on other things!

Reviews.Title: “central located, quiet, sufficient place, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We, two adults and one children, stayed three nights in this hotel. The room was just sufficient for three persons, the roll away bed was expensive ($ 15 + tax) compared to its quality. Our room was on the 1st floor, a quiet place but with a strange smell; kitchen with refrigerator, shared toilets and showers. Some furniture should be repaired. The room service and the friendlyness of the employees was o.k. Only the breakfast was poor (juice, coffee or tea, but only one piece of pastries per person) and the lift sometimes did not want to go to the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In June 2005, a friend and I stayed at the larchmont hotel. At first the idea of shared bathrooms grossed me out, but I never waited for that bathroom once in my five day stay, not to mention that it was always clean. The staff was friendly and professional. The decor was not the most sophisticated but most people don't come to NYC to sit in their rooms all day and night. I would recommend this hotel to people who want to come to new york to spend their money on fun things and not an overpriced hotel. My friend and I decided to make an annual trip to New York, and we will stay at the Larchmont every time.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean, but cheap & good location”
Reviews.Author: BellinghamSojourner
Reviews.Content: The Larchmont Hotel in Greenwich Village was perfect for my husband and me because it was inexpensive ($109/night) and had a nice location on a quiet street near a terrific neighborhood Italian restaurant called Gene's. We were happy enough with the great location and safe-feeling locale, and we were able to request an extra-large room. For people who can tolerate some uncleanliness in the room and the shared bathroom area, I would recommend this hotel. It was a few blocks to the nearest subway stop, but the neighborhood along the way is colorful. Being a few blocks away from NYU was great for when we wanted to explore the bookstore near Washington Square Park. The staff at the Larchmont was helpful and pleasant. A good choice for travelers who would rather spend loads of money on great restaurants or shows than on fancy hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Viable option for NYC”
Reviews.Author: richmond
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a well-located, clean, reasonably priced and roomy option for our visit to NYC to see colleges. Close to transportation and in an area accessible to restaurants, etc., the Larchmont was as we expected. The shared toilet and shower facilities were clean, but very tight.

Reviews.Title: “Economically Delightful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a simple little hotel that doesn't pretend to be anything more than it is and rightly so. Comfortable, clean, functional and affordable, the Larchmont is ideal for those seeking a decent place to sleep in New York on a limited budget. I stayed for five nights back in January 2005: it was pleasantly warm, my TV worked well, the beds were comfortable, the toilets were impressively clean, and the simplisitc breakfast was sufficient for a short stay. It is set in an attractive quiet little street in 'the Village', being ideally placed for walking around New York's major sites or jumping on the bus or subway. The staff were amicable and at times congenial, though often I found them to be rather melancholy; however, they still got the job done and I have no noteable complaints. There were a couple of residents on my floor, both of whom were incredibly welcoming and treated the communal kitchen area as the 'best cafe in New York' - wonderful. Don't expect the Ritz, don't expect to be pampered ... this is simple 'no frills' accommodation that does everything the independent and modestly minded visitor will require. I would definately return here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Larchmont Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 27 West 11th Street, New York City, NY 10011
